original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa la rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste gcig tu gyur nas mang por gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa la rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste gcig tu gyur nas mang por gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The superknowledge of magical power is the perfect conquest of the various kinds of magical transformation by means of magical power.

original: sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi'i la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfect conquest of the hearing of various sounds is the hearing of the sounds of gods, humans, etc.

original: sems can gzhan dag gi sems can gyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyu ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya🔽ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag gi sems can gyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyu ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The perfect conquest of the entry into the thoughts of other beings is the perfect knowledge of the activities of the minds of other beings, such as their being attached, etc.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las brtsams te /
translated: The perfect conquest of the recollection of former existences is the recollection of former existences, beginning with one’s own lineage of lives.

original: ming dang rigs dang rus la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i lo drung @95b shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ming dang rigs dang rus la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i lo drung @95b shes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge of the life-span, lineage, clan, etc. of beings is called the knowledge of the life-span.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mngon par shes pa ni lha'i mig gis sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te /🔽'chi 'pho dang skye ba mthong ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mngon par shes pa ni lha'i mig gis sems can 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / kha dog bzang po dang / kha dog ngan pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba dang / phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mthong ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the death and rebirth of sentient beings by means of the divine eye, and the knowledge of good and bad complexions, of those who go to good destinies and those who go to bad destinies, beginning from the far side.

original: zag pa zad pa shes pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis zag pa rnams yongs su zad pa dang / de dag yongs su zad pa gang yin pa de shes pa 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba ni thabs gang gis zag pa rnams yongs su zad pa dang / de dag yongs su zad pa gang yin pa de shes pa 'grub pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of the impurities is the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities, which is the cause of the accomplishment of the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.🔽The knowledge of the extinction of the impurities is the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities, which is the cause of the accomplishment of the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.

original: mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po rnams ni gang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi skus 'dul ba rnams la kun du ston to //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po rnams ni gang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi skus 'dul ba rnams la kun du ston to //
translated: The marks and signs are the form body of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, which is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great person and the eighty minor characteristics, and which is manifested by them through the power of concentration and wisdom for the sake of those who are to be trained by the form body.

original: de dag gi de dag ni de'i rang bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi de dag ni de'i rang bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be known as the nature of concentration and wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are distinguished by the Dharma body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar ston nus pa rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar ston nus pa rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are able to manifest in that way should be known as having the nature of concentration and wisdom.

original: nga la gzhan pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu skyes pa rnams ni de las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nga la gzhan pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu skyes pa rnams ni de las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who are born in the circle of the retinue of the Buddha, other than those, should be known as having the nature of the evolutionary development of that.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su dag pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four purities of the bhagavat buddhas and the bodhisattvas who have attained the great higher perceptions are as follows.🔽Purity of realm is the correct attainment of taking birth wherever one wishes, abiding there, and giving it up.

original: de la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gnas len ba dang / bzhugs pa dang / yongs su gtong ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang du bzhed pa der skye ba 'dzin pa dang / der skyes nas kyang tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te ji srid bzhed par bzhugs pa dang /🔽gang gi tshe bzhed pa de'i dus na tshe de'i 'du byed 'der ba ste /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gnas len ba dang / bzhugs pa dang / yongs su gtong ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang du bzhed pa der skye ba 'dzin pa dang / der skyes nas kyang tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te ji srid bzhed par bzhugs pa dang / gang gi tshe bzhed pa de'i dus na tshe de'i 'du byed 'der ba ste /
translated: Purity of intention is the correct attainment of being able to do whatever one wishes for the sake of sentient beings.🔽Purity of wisdom is the correct attainment of knowing all objects of knowledge in all aspects.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: Purity of method is the correct attainment of being able to display all kinds of emanations.

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i sprul pa dang sgyur ba dang / mkhyen pa yang dag par 'byor pa dang zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa sprul pa dang / sngon byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa gser la sogs par bsgyur ba dang /
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du dmigs pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i sprul pa dang sgyur ba dang / mkhyen pa yang dag par 'byor pa dang zhes bya ba ni sngon ma byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa sprul pa dang / sngon byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa gser la sogs par bsgyur ba dang /
translated: Mastery of knowledge is the emanation of form, etc. that did not exist before, the transformation of form, etc. that did exist before into gold, etc.,

original: rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir de go rims bzhin no //🔽ji @96a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir de go rims bzhin no // ji @96a * //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects, respectively.🔽As desired, he has mastery over the door of concentration.

original: ltar bzhed pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang sgyur ba yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig re re la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gzhan dpag tu med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltar bzhed pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang sgyur ba yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig re re la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gzhan dpag tu med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He enters other immeasurable concentrations, as desired, in each instant.

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo kun du 'dzin pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis las yi ge gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa na des thog ma kho nar chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad🔽brjod nus pa thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gzungs kyi sgo kun du 'dzin pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba ni yi ge bzhi bcu rtsa gnyis las yi ge gang yang rung ba yid la byed pa na des thog ma kho nar chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad brjod nus pa thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that when they bring to mind any of the forty-two letters, they first attain the ability to express all the categories of Dharma.

original: stobs ni bcu ste /
analyzed: stobs ni bcu ste /
translated: The ten powers are as follows:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang // bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang // bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The power of knowing what is possible and impossible, the power of knowing one’s own and others’ actions and their ripening, the power of knowing the various dhātus, the power of knowing the various higher interests, the power of knowing the various faculties, the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere, the power of knowing one’s own and others’ absorptions, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis, the power of knowing the recollection of former lives, the power of knowing death and rebirth, and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / shi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing death and rebirth,

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs so //
translated: and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni bsam gtan la brten nas rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa mngon du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni bsam gtan la brten nas rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa mngon du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of knowing what is possible and impossible is the concentration of direct realization and so on, which is unattached and unobstructed knowledge of all aspects of causes and non-causes based on concentration.

original: de bzhin du las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa la yang rnam pa thams cad du de mkhyen pa chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa mngon du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs la sogs pa la yang rnam pa thams cad du de mkhyen pa chags pa med cing thogs pa med pa mngon du gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same applies to the powers of knowledge of the possible and impossible, etc.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The four fearlessnesses are as follows:

original: nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba 'di la chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes dge sbyong dang / bra ma ze 'am /
analyzed: nga mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba 'di la chos 'di dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes dge sbyong dang / bra ma ze 'am /
translated: “I am perfectly enlightened with regard to all dharmas.”

original: lha 'am / bdud dam //
analyzed: lha 'am / bdud dam //
translated: No ascetic, brahman, god, Mara,

original: tshangs pa'am / sus kyang chos dang mthun par nga la rgol ba'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / sus kyang chos dang mthun par nga la rgol ba'am /
translated: Brahma, or anyone else can reasonably contradict me,🔽saying that I have not realized this or that.

original: drod bar byed pa'i mtshan ma mi mthong ste /
analyzed: drod bar byed pa'i mtshan ma mi mthong ste /
translated: I do not see any reason why they could reasonably do so.

original: mtshan ma de mi mthong bas bde ba thob mi 'jigs pa thob bag tsha ba med pa thob nas gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma de mi mthong bas bde ba thob mi 'jigs pa thob bag tsha ba med pa thob nas gnas so //
translated: I have attained security, attained fearlessness, and attained the utmost self-confidence.

original: khyu mchog gi gnas rgya chen por zhal gyis @96b 'che'o //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas rgya chen por zhal gyis @96b 'che'o //
translated: I live as the foremost victor, the great leader.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: I turn the wheel of the Dharma in the great assembly.

original: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog go //🔽nga zag pa zad do zhes bya ba la zag ba 'di dag yongs su ma zad do /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog go // nga zag pa zad do zhes bya ba la zag ba 'di dag yongs su ma zad do /
translated: He roars the lion's roar in the assemblies and sets the wheel of Brahmā turning.🔽He says, I have exhausted the contaminants, and no one can oppose him by saying, You have not exhausted such-and-such a contaminant.🔽 He says, I have taught that these are the obstructions for my disciples, and even if they practice them, they will not become obstructed, and no one can oppose him by saying,

original: zhes bya ba dang ngas nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos gang dag bstan pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / yang ngas nyan thos rnams la nges bar 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang ngas nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod pa'i chos gang dag bstan pa de dag bsten kyang bar du gcad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / yang ngas nyan thos rnams la nges bar 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Your disciples will become obstructed by practicing those.

original: 'phags pa nges par 'byin pa des par 'byung pa'i lam gang bshad pa de nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa nges par 'byin pa des par 'byung pa'i lam gang bshad pa de nges par 'byung ba ma yin no zhe'am /
translated: He says, “I have taught this path for my disciples to attain definite release, and there is no other path for definite release,” and no one can oppose him by saying,

original: de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tha ma byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'di la dge sbyong ngam sus kyang nga la zhes bya ba nas seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ces bya ba'i bar du rgya cher re re la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tha ma byed par mi 'gyur ro zhes 'di la dge sbyong ngam sus kyang nga la zhes bya ba nas seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ces bya ba'i bar du rgya cher re re la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And he would not be able to roar the lion's roar in the assembly.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po 'di dag ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don las brtsam par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po 'di dag ni rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don las brtsam par rig par bya'o //
translated: These four kinds of fearlessness should be understood as undertaken for one's own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: de la rang gi don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rang gi don ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, one's own benefit is twofold:

original: ye shes kyi khyad par dang / spangs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par dang / spangs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: the special knowledge and the special abandonment.

original: gzhan gyi don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The benefit of others is also twofold:

original: mi mthun pa'i chos yongs su spang ba dang / gnyen po'i chos la brten pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos yongs su spang ba dang / gnyen po'i chos la brten pa'o //
translated: the abandonment of the opposing side and the reliance on the antidote.

original: de la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid de rang gi don la brtsams nas rnam pa thams cad du ngas rab tu dbye ba'i mtha' dang bcas par shes par bya ba mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes zhal🔽gyis 'che ba ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la mi 'jigs pa ni ye shes kyi bdag nyid de rang gi don la brtsams nas rnam pa thams cad du ngas rab tu dbye ba'i mtha' dang bcas par shes par bya ba mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes zhal gyis 'che ba ste /
translated: The fearlessness of perfect enlightenment is the nature of knowledge. It is the proclamation, in all its aspects, of the knowledge of the limits of the possible and the impossible, which is made by the Buddha, the Lord of Sages, for the sake of himself:🔽“I have attained supreme enlightenment.”

original: yang dag par rgol ba med par 'jig rten thams cad du 'jog pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rgol ba med par 'jig rten thams cad du 'jog pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The concentration of the mastery of the knowledge of the destruction of all the impurities is the same as before.

original: mi 'jigs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽zag pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // zag pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The other fearlessnesses should be understood in the same way.🔽“All the aspects of the impurities” should be understood as the afflictions together with their traces.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad du rig par bya'o //
translated: “All the aspects of the obstacles” should be understood as all the afflictions that are adverse elements.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sbyor ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sbyor ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The aspect of the path that definitely leads to deliverance should be understood as beginning with the path of preparation

original: mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: and continuing up to the path of completion.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni 'di la ston pa thugs brtse ba can thugs rje dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni 'di la ston pa thugs brtse ba can thugs rje dang ldan pa /
translated: The three closely placed recollections are as follows: Here, the compassionate Teacher, the one endowed with compassion,

original: don bzhed pa /
analyzed: don bzhed pa /
translated: the one who desires the Dharma,

original: phan par bzhed pa /
analyzed: phan par bzhed pa /
translated: the one who desires benefit,🔽the one who desires happiness, the one endowed with compassion teaches the Dharma to the disciples, saying:

original: thugs rje can nyan thos rnams la dge slong dag 'di ni phan @97a * //🔽par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rje can nyan thos rnams la dge slong dag 'di ni phan @97a * // par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Monks, this is beneficial,🔽this is happiness,

original: 'di ni bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: this is beneficial and happiness.”

original: 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'o zhes chos ston pa 'di la nyan thos de dag gus par nyan pa dang / rna ba gtod pa dang / kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'o zhes chos ston pa 'di la nyan thos de dag gus par nyan pa dang / rna ba gtod pa dang / kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur /
translated: The Tathāgata does not delight in those disciples who listen with respect, who pay attention, who apply their minds to understanding, and who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not feel pleased.

original: thugs dga' ba ya ya por mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de bzhin gshes pa de la gnas te /
analyzed: thugs dga' ba ya ya por mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de bzhin gshes pa de la gnas te /
translated: He does not become pleased or displeased, but remains equanimous, mindful and fully aware.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pa 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po ste /
translated: This is the first foundation of mindfulness that is not shared by disciples.

original: gang 'phags pa bsten nas kyang 'khor la rjes su bstan par 'os pa'o //🔽gzhan yang ston pa 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du chos ston pa de la nyon thos de dag gus par mi nyan pa nas /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa bsten nas kyang 'khor la rjes su bstan par 'os pa'o // gzhan yang ston pa 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du chos ston pa de la nyon thos de dag gus par mi nyan pa nas /
translated: It is suitable for the noble ones to teach it to their followers.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub ba'i bar de la de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub ba'i bar de la de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su mi 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, when the disciples do not listen respectfully to the teaching of the Dharma by this teacher, up to they do not practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, the Tathāgata does not become angry,

original: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not become intolerant,

original: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not become distrustful,🔽does not become displeased, but remains equanimous, mindful and fully aware.

original: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de la zhes bya ba rgya cher sbyar te 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de la zhes bya ba rgya cher sbyar te 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second foundation of mindfulness that is not shared by disciples.

original: gsum pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference in the third is as follows:

original: de la nyan thos kha cig gus par nyan pa nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa dang / kha cig gus par mi nyan pa nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub pa'i bar de la de bzhin gshegs par dgyes par mi 'gyur ba nas thugs mi mnyen par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la nyan thos kha cig gus par nyan pa nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub par byed pa dang / kha cig gus par mi nyan pa nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub pa'i bar de la de bzhin gshegs par dgyes par mi 'gyur ba nas thugs mi mnyen par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Some disciples listen respectfully, practice the teaching in accord with the teaching, while others do not listen respectfully, and do not practice the teaching in accord with the teaching. The Tathagata is neither pleased nor displeased, neither rejoices nor grieves, neither makes an effort nor relaxes his effort.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum po 'di dag ni ston pa'i tshogs yongs su sdud pa la go rims bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / de gnyi ga'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags kyi rnam pa thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum po 'di dag ni ston pa'i tshogs yongs su sdud pa la go rims bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / de gnyi ga'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags kyi rnam pa thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: These three establishments of mindfulness are the concentrations of the perfect conquest of the assembly of teachers, in order, of the absence of attachment, of the absence of aversion, and of the absence of the defilement of both, and of the non-arising of all the aspects of the residues.

original: bsrung ba med ba gsum ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bsrung ba med ba gsum ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i phrin las kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The three safeguards are the purification of the Tathagata's bodily activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med de /
translated: The Tathagata has no impure physical action.🔽He has no intention to conceal anything, thinking, “Others will know about me.”

original: bdag la gzhan gyis shes su 'ong ngo zhes bcab par dgongs pa med pa dang / de bzhin du gsung dang / thugs kyi phrin las la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la gzhan gyis shes su 'ong ngo zhes bcab par dgongs pa med pa dang / de bzhin du gsung dang / thugs kyi phrin las la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for his verbal and mental actions.

original: de dag gi tha snyad @97b gdags su med par dogs pa mi mda' ba'i phyir /🔽ston pa nyid kyis gdul ba'i skye bo sdug pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag gi tha snyad @97b gdags su med par dogs pa mi mda' ba'i phyir / ston pa nyid kyis gdul ba'i skye bo sdug pa las brtsams te /
translated: Because he is not afraid of being unable to respond to the questions of others,

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du tshar bcad de spa bkod nas gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa la sbyor ba yang dag par 'byor par rig par bya'o //🔽bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid ni gdul ba'i bya ba thams cad las brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du tshar bcad de spa bkod nas gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa la sbyor ba yang dag par 'byor par rig par bya'o // bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid ni gdul ba'i bya ba thams cad las brtsams te /
translated: the Master is skilled in instructing and guiding those to be trained, having first subdued and inspired them as he wishes.🔽The Dharma of nonforgetfulness is the concentration, etc.,

original: ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad pa dang gsungs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mngon par brjod pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du mdzad pa dang gsungs pa'i rnam pa thams cad mngon par brjod pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: that are skilled in all the activities of training, in the performance and teaching of everything, and in the expression of all aspects.

original: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni thams cad mkhyen par gyur nas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i lhag ma yod pa ston pa'i sku dang gsung gi g-yo ba kun du mi 'byung ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags yang dag par bcom pa ni thams cad mkhyen par gyur nas nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i lhag ma yod pa ston pa'i sku dang gsung gi g-yo ba kun du mi 'byung ba yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: The complete destruction of habitual tendencies is the attainment of omniscience, and the non-occurrence of all movements of body and speech which show the remaining obscurations of the passions and the knowable.

original: thugs rje chen po ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i thugs rje la gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad la dmigs pa'i thugs rje la gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the attainment of concentration, etc., which is the basis of compassion which has as its object all the varieties of suffering of all the living beings who live in the three worlds.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bco brgyad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa ni bco brgyad de /
translated: The special qualities of the Buddha are eighteen.

original: 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa dang / ca co med pa dang / bsnyel ba med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa dang /
translated: They are as follows: the Thus-Gone One is without error, without babbling, without forgetfulness, without a mind that is not in equipoise, without different kinds of perceptions, without indifference that is not thoroughly investigated,

original: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dun pa nyams pa med pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa med pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin nyams pa med pa dang / shes rab nyams pa med pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa dang /
translated: without loss of aspiration, without loss of diligence, without loss of mindfulness, without loss of meditative absorption, without loss of wisdom, without loss of liberation,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / ngag gi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
translated: all the verbal actions of the Tathāgata are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge; all the mental actions of the Tathāgata are preceded by knowledge and follow knowledge.🔽The knowledge of the Tathāgata is unobstructed and unhampered with regard to the past;🔽the knowledge of the Tathāgata is unobstructed and unhampered with regard to the future;

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the knowledge of the Tathāgata is unobstructed and unhampered with regard to the present.

original: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The establishment of these is as follows:

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du rgyu ba na res 'ga' glang po che @98a * //
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du rgyu ba na res 'ga' glang po che @98a * //
translated: When a bhikṣu arhat who has exhausted the contaminants goes to a village for alms, sometimes an elephant

original: gtum po dang lhan cig 'gro ba dang // glang po che gtum po ji lta ba de bzhin du rta gtum po dang / ba rdung khus ma dang / khyi za ba dang / tshang tshing tsher mas 'dzings pa dang / sprul la rkang pa gnyis kas rdzi ba dang /
analyzed: gtum po dang lhan cig 'gro ba dang // glang po che gtum po ji lta ba de bzhin du rta gtum po dang / ba rdung khus ma dang / khyi za ba dang / tshang tshing tsher mas 'dzings pa dang / sprul la rkang pa gnyis kas rdzi ba dang /
translated: Like a wild elephant, a wild horse, a mad bull, a rabid dog, a thicket of brambles, a snake,

original: gang du bud med mi rigs pa skyes pas bos pa'i khyim de lta bur 'jug pa dang / dgon par lam nor nas lam log par 'gro ba dang / chom rkun rnams dang / rkun po rnams dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / spyang ki dang lhan cig 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: gang du bud med mi rigs pa skyes pas bos pa'i khyim de lta bur 'jug pa dang / dgon par lam nor nas lam log par 'gro ba dang / chom rkun rnams dang / rkun po rnams dang / seng ge dang / stag dang / spyang ki dang lhan cig 'gro ba dang /
translated: or a house where a woman is calling out to a man who is not her husband, or a place where there are thieves, robbers, lions, tigers, or wolves.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa la sogs pa dgra bcom pa'i 'khrul pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa la sogs pa dgra bcom pa'i 'khrul pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagata is completely free of all such errors.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa res 'ga' dgon pa na nags khrod chen por rgyu ba na lam nor te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa res 'ga' dgon pa na nags khrod chen por rgyu ba na lam nor te /
translated: Moreover, Arhats sometimes, when wandering in the great forests of the wilderness, lose their way.

original: grong stong du phyin nas sgra 'byin pa dang / sgra sgrogs pa dang / ku co cher 'don pa dang / bag chags kyi nyes pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gad mo rta gad so snang bar dgod pa dang / 'phya ba nye bar ston pa dang /🔽de lta bu dang mthun pa dgra bcom pa'i ca co de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga' ba'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba med de nyon mongs pa med par yun ring po nas mdzad pa dang gsungs pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grong stong du phyin nas sgra 'byin pa dang / sgra sgrogs pa dang / ku co cher 'don pa dang / bag chags kyi nyes pa la brten nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gad mo rta gad so snang bar dgod pa dang / 'phya ba nye bar ston pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dgra bcom pa'i ca co de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga' ba'o // de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba med de nyon mongs pa med par yun ring po nas mdzad pa dang gsungs pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He makes a sound, a noise, a great clamor when he enters an empty village, and he laughs a derisive, malicious laugh, based on the fault of habit, and he shows contempt.🔽The Tathagata does not have such a cough, nor does he have any of the other things mentioned above.🔽The Tathagata has no loss of mindfulness, because he is without defilement and is mindful of what he has done and said for a long time.🔽

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs nas mnyam par bzhag par 'gyur gyi langs nas mnyam par bzhag pa ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs nas mnyam par bzhag par 'gyur gyi langs nas mnyam par bzhag pa ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med do //
translated: He laughs loudly, he laughs with a loud voice, he laughs with a loud sound, he laughs with a loud noise, he laughs with a loud report, he laughs with a loud roar, he laughs with a loud shout, he laughs with a loud cry, he laughs with a loud cackle, he laughs with a loud whoop, he laughs with a loud hoot, he laughs with a loud cheer, he laughs with a loud yell, he laughs with a loud whistle, he laughs with a loud shriek, he laughs with a loud howl, he laughs with a loud screech, he laughs with a loud ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho, he laughs with a loud he-he, he laughs with a loud ha-ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho-ho, he laughs with a loud he-he-he, he laughs with a loud ha-ha-ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi-hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho-ho-ho, he laughs with a loud he-he-he-he, he laughs with a loud ha-ha-ha-ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi-hi-hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho-ho-ho-ho, he laughs with a loud he-he-he-he-he, he laughs with a loud ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi-hi-hi-hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho, he laughs with a loud he-he-he-he-he-he, he laughs with a loud ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi-hi-hi-hi-hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho-ho, he laughs with a loud he-he-he-he-he-he-he, he laughs with a loud ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha-ha, he laughs with a loud hi-hi-hi-hi-hi-hi-hi-hi, he laughs with a loud ho-ho-ho-ho-ho

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la shin tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su lta zhing phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la shin tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su lta zhing phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the arhat views the aggregates with a notion of great incompatibility and has the notion that nirvāṇa, which is the absence of the aggregates, is peace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni phung po dang mya ngan las 'das pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mda'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni phung po dang mya ngan las 'das pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mda'o //
translated: But the Tathāgata does not have the notion that the aggregates and nirvāṇa are different.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ro //
translated: Moreover, the arhat forsakes the welfare of sentient beings without examination.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de lta bu dang mthun pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mda'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de lta bu dang mthun pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mda'o //
translated: But the Tathāgata does not have such an unexamined equanimity.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa las brtsams te /
translated: Moreover, the arhat, beginning with the purification of the obscurations to omniscience,

original: 'dun pa las kyang ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas @98b yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: 'dun pa las kyang ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas @98b yongs su nyams so //
translated: falls away from his attainment through the loss of his aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus dang / dran ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las kyang yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / dran ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las kyang yongs su nyams so //
translated: He also falls away from his vigor, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, and liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni yongs su nyams pa rnam pa 'di drug med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni yongs su nyams pa rnam pa 'di drug med do //
translated: The Tathagata does not have these six kinds of falling away.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni res 'ga' lus kyi las dge ba la 'jug / res 'ga' lung du ma bstan pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni res 'ga' lus kyi las dge ba la 'jug / res 'ga' lung du ma bstan pa la 'jug go //
translated: Moreover, the Arhat sometimes engages in virtuous bodily actions, and sometimes he engages in indeterminate actions.

original: lus kyi las ji lta bar dag gi las dang yid kyi las kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi las ji lta bar dag gi las dang yid kyi las kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for his speech and mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gsum po ni ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i las med do //🔽de la ye shes kun nas slong ba'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gsum po ni ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i las med do // de la ye shes kun nas slong ba'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The Tathagata does not have indeterminate actions, because his three kinds of actions are preceded by and follow after his knowledge.🔽They are preceded by knowledge because his knowledge instigates them.

original: ye shes dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i phyir ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i phyir ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: They follow after knowledge because they are in conformity with his knowledge.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni rtsol btsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni rtsol btsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the Arhats do not realize the things that are knowable in the three times merely by wishing to do so.

original: des na de'i ye shes mthong ba chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i ye shes mthong ba chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their vision of pristine wisdom is obstructed.

original: thams cad rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not realize everything.

original: des na de'i ye shes mthong ba thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i ye shes mthong ba thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their vision of pristine wisdom is impeded.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs te /
translated: The Tathāgata realizes all the things that are knowable in the three times merely by wishing to do so.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, these are called the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: de la 'di dag las dang po drug ni sku dang gsungs dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di dag las dang po drug ni sku dang gsungs dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first six are the distinctive qualities of the Buddha that consist of the purification of the activities of body, speech, and mind, such as the meditative absorption called “perfect prosperity.🔽”

original: de la 'khrul pa med ces bya ba 'di ni sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa med ces bya ba 'di ni sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: Among them, the phrase “he is without error” refers to the purification of the activity of the body.

original: ca co med ces bya ba 'di ni gsung gi phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: ca co med ces bya ba 'di ni gsung gi phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The absence of idle chatter is to be understood as referring to the purity of his verbal action.

original: bsnyel ba med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med ces bya ba 'di bzhis ni thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //🔽'dun pa nyams pa med ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: bsnyel ba med pa dang / tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med ces bya ba 'di bzhis ni thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o // 'dun pa nyams pa med ces bya ba nas /
translated: The absence of loss, the absence of different kinds of ideas, the absence of a non-concentrated mind, and the absence of non-discernment are to be understood as referring to the purity of his mental action.

original: rnam par grol ba nyams pa med ces bya ba'i bar du drug ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po gnas dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pa med pa yang dag par 'byor @99a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyams pa med ces bya ba'i bar du drug ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po gnas dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pa med pa yang dag par 'byor @99a * //
translated: The six beginning with the absence of loss of zeal and ending with the absence of loss of liberation refer to the absence of loss of the Tathāgata’s faculties, with their bases and fruits, in one who has attained them.

original: pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the absence of loss of the concentration, etc.🔽of one who is perfectly endowed.

original: de la gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Here, zeal is the base.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Liberation is the fruit.

original: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The faculties are to be known as effort and so on.

original: lus kyi las dang dag gi las dang yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya pa 'di gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phrin las mdzad pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs🔽pa'o // 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lus kyi las dang dag gi las dang yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya pa 'di gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phrin las mdzad pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o // 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba nas /
translated: These three, all physical, verbal, and mental actions are preceded by and follow after pristine wisdom, are the meditative stabilization of the perfect achievement of the performance of deeds that is not shared in common.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la zhes bya ba 'di gsum ni ye shes la gnas pa thun mong ma yin pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la zhes bya ba 'di gsum ni ye shes la gnas pa thun mong ma yin pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: These three, pristine wisdom that is not attached to and not obstructed in the past time, and so on up to pristine wisdom that is not attached to and not obstructed in the present time, are the meditative stabilization of the perfect achievement of the pristine wisdom that is not shared in common.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba'i mthar thug pa mkhyen pa grub ces
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dang rab tu dbye ba'i mthar thug pa mkhyen pa grub ces
translated: The phrase “the complete attainment of the knowledge of all the aspects of the aggregates, constituents, and sense fields” means that he has achieved the knowledge of the final nature, specific characteristics, and categories of the aggregates, etc.

original: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what the passage means.

original: de dag ni mngon par sgrub pa'i gnas dang / mngon par sgrub pa po gang zag dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i thabs kyis yongs su bstan to //🔽mngon par sgrub pa'i thabs ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du lan mang du yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par sgrub pa'i gnas dang / mngon par sgrub pa po gang zag dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i thabs kyis yongs su bstan to // mngon par sgrub pa'i thabs ni ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du lan mang du yid la byed pa ste /
translated: These are the topics that are accomplished: the basis of accomplishment, the person who accomplishes, and the means of accomplishment.🔽The means of accomplishment is the repeated attention to the teachings as they have been presented.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sems mnyam par gzhag nas yang dang yang de la 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sems mnyam par gzhag nas yang dang yang de la 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that, after one has settled the mind in meditative equipoise in accordance with the teachings, one repeatedly places the mind there.

original: 'di lta ste tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pa byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan ba bsam gtan la brten nas bsams pas yid la byed pas mang du byed do //🔽de bzhin du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pas gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pas mang du byed do zhes sbyar bar bya'o //🔽tshad med pa la sogs pa yon tan 'di dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pa byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med pa 'gran zla med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan ba bsam gtan la brten nas bsams pas yid la byed pas mang du byed do // de bzhin du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pas gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pas mang du byed do zhes sbyar bar bya'o // tshad med pa la sogs pa yon tan 'di dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Thus, one who wishes to accomplish the immeasurables cultivates the mental attention of the establishment of the immeasurables, as indicated by the statement: “One who wishes to accomplish the immeasurables should cultivate the mental attention of the establishment of the immeasurables, i.e., the mind endowed with loving-kindness that is immeasurable, without enmity, and without enmity, etc.”

original: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa ni gang dag gis 'phags pa ci rigs su mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa ni gang dag gis 'phags pa ci rigs su mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa'i las byed pa'o //

original: gnas pa las gyur pa ni mchog tu zhi ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa la sogs pa gang dag gis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las gyur pa ni mchog tu zhi ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa la sogs pa gang dag gis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The immeasurables that consist of the nondiscriminative, highest pacification, which is included in the knowledge of the object, are the immeasurables that are without objective reference.

original: de la tshad med pa rnams kyis mi @99b mthun pa'i phyogs spong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de la tshad med pa rnams kyis mi @99b mthun pa'i phyogs spong ngo zhes bya ba ni gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: The immeasurables eliminate the resistances, i.e., malice, violence, dissatisfaction, attachment, and anger, respectively.

original: tshad med pa bzhi po 'di dag ni snying brtse ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi po 'di dag ni snying brtse ba zhes bya ste /
translated: These four immeasurables are called “compassion”

original: 'di dag gis sems can gyi don gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis sems can gyi don gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are engaged in the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas na sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bar gnas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi gnas na sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bar gnas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the Lord, abiding in compassion for all sentient beings, accomplishes the accumulation of merit.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa la yongs su mi skyo ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa la yongs su mi skyo ste /
translated: Therefore, he is not discouraged in bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bas bdag la mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bas bdag la mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is compassionate toward all sentient beings, he is not self-centered.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams las gnyis kyis ni sprul pa'i lam mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams las gnyis kyis ni sprul pa'i lam mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: By means of the first two liberations, he accomplishes the path of emanation.

original: gsum pas ni dge ba sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pas ni dge ba sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the third, he is not defiled by the emanation of virtue.

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa rnams la mi chags so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhi ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa rnams la mi chags so //
translated: By means of the four formless liberations, he is not attached to the peaceful liberations.

original: tha mas ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pas nas te /
analyzed: tha mas ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pas nas te /
translated: By means of the last, he is liberated by the supreme peaceful state of the noble ones.

original: de la de ltar mos pa'i don ni rnam par thar pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la de ltar mos pa'i don ni rnam par thar pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of such an aspiration should be understood as the meaning of liberation.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'i las kyang snga ma bzhin du de bstan pa'i tshul du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'i las kyang snga ma bzhin du de bstan pa'i tshul du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The functions of the spheres of mastery, etc., should be applied in the same way as above, according to the method of teaching.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas ni gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba gces su byed pas ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du smra ba'i phyir gzung ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas ni gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba gces su byed pas ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du smra ba'i phyir gzung ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: By being free of afflictions, he speaks in accordance with what is suitable, because he values protecting the minds of others.

original: bsams nas shes pas ni thams cad shes so zhes gus par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten na mang pos bkur bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: bsams nas shes pas ni thams cad shes so zhes gus par bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten na mang pos bkur bar 'gyur ro /
translated: By knowing through reflection, he is honored by many in the world, because he knows everything.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis ni rnam pa sna tshogs mang pos the tshom gcod pa'i phyir bshad pas sems can rnams kyi sems tshim par mdzad do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis ni rnam pa sna tshogs mang pos the tshom gcod pa'i phyir bshad pas sems can rnams kyi sems tshim par mdzad do //
translated: By means of the correct knowledges, he satisfies the minds of sentient beings with his explanations, because he cuts through their doubts with many kinds of aspects.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni go rims bzhin du lus kyi las la sogs pas bstan pa la 'dun par mdzad do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni go rims bzhin du lus kyi las la sogs pas bstan pa la 'dun par mdzad do //
translated: By means of the superknowledges of magical power, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of past lives, knowledge of death and rebirth, and knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants, he causes them to aspire to the teaching by means of his physical actions and so forth.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas ni sgra'i rnam pa thams cad rtogs nas ngag gi las kyis 'dun par mdzad par rig par bya'o //🔽gnas yongs su dag pas ni ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gnas len pa dang / bzhugs @100a * //🔽pa dang / yongs su gtong pa'i dbang du byas nas srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa gsum du rig par bya'o //🔽dmigs pa yongs su dag pas ni chos la dbang sgyur ro //🔽sems yongs su dag pas ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas ni sgra'i rnam pa thams cad rtogs nas ngag gi las kyis 'dun par mdzad par rig par bya'o // gnas yongs su dag pas ni ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gnas len pa dang / bzhugs @100a * // pa dang / yongs su gtong pa'i dbang du byas nas srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa gsum du rig par bya'o // dmigs pa yongs su dag pas ni chos la dbang sgyur ro // sems yongs su dag pas ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur ro //
translated: By means of the superknowledge of the divine ear, having understood all the aspects of sound, he should be known to attract them by means of his speech.

original: ye shes yongs su dag pas ni dam pa'i chos yang dag par 'dzin to //🔽stobs rnams kyi nang nas stobs gnyis kyis ni mngon bar mtho ba'i lam ston to //🔽lhag ma rnams kyis ni nges par legs pa'i lam ston te //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa ni 'di dag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mdzad pa ni 'di dag go //
translated: These are the deeds of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni mngon par mtho ba rgyu med pa las byung ba dang / rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba de spong ngo //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni mngon par mtho ba rgyu med pa las byung ba dang / rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba de spong ngo //
translated: Among them, by means of the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions, the Blessed One abandons the assertion that the higher realms arise without a cause, or that they arise from a cause that is not a proper condition, such as a divine creator or Īśvara.

original: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni las bdag gis ma byas kyang las 'ong ngo zhes ma byas pa dang phrad par smra ba de spong ngo //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni las bdag gis ma byas kyang las 'ong ngo zhes ma byas pa dang phrad par smra ba de spong ngo //
translated: By means of the power of knowledge regarding the absorptions, liberations, etc., the Blessed One abandons the assertion that one encounters the results of actions that one has not performed.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par ma nor bar bde 'gro'i lam ston to //🔽bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par ma nor bar bde 'gro'i lam ston to // bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams te ;
translated: In this way, he teaches the unerring path to the higher realms.🔽By means of the power of knowledge regarding the paths that lead to all the different realms, the Blessed One knows the mental behavior of sentient beings,

original: sems kyi rgyu ba rnams rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ba rnams rjes su rtogs so //
translated: that is, the movements of their minds.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bshad pa'i snod dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po yongs su smin pa rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bshad pa'i snod dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po yongs su smin pa rjes su rtogs so //
translated: By the power of knowledge of the supreme and not supreme faculties, one realizes the vessel of explanation, the fully ripened faculties of faith and so on.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa ste /
translated: By the power of knowledge of various resolves, one realizes the intention.

original: ngan pa dang bzang po la mos pa rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: ngan pa dang bzang po la mos pa rjes su rtogs so //
translated: One realizes inferior and excellent resolve.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bag la nyal skyed nus pa'i nyon mongs pa rjes su rtogs so //🔽thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni dmigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bag la nyal skyed nus pa'i nyon mongs pa rjes su rtogs so // thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni dmigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: By the power of knowledge of various elements, one realizes the latent states that are able to generate affliction.🔽By the power of knowledge of all paths and their respective destinations, one realizes the focal object subsumed by the teachings of the Listeners' Vehicle or

original: theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos kyis bsdus pa rjes su rtogs so ;
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos kyis bsdus pa rjes su rtogs so ;
translated: the Great Vehicle.

original: / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni tshe rabs snga ma dag na tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni tshe rabs snga ma dag na tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu rjes su rtogs so //
translated: By the power of knowledge of recollection of past lives, one realizes the cause of the ārya path, the correct accomplishment of the accumulations in former lives.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni phyi ma la 'os su 'gyur ba rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni phyi ma la 'os su 'gyur ba rjes su rtogs so //
translated: By the power of knowledge of death and rebirth, he realizes the future.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis @100b ni 'jig rten thams cad nas nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs te /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis @100b ni 'jig rten thams cad nas nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs te /
translated: By the power of knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, he realizes the deliverance from the entire world.

original: gang las ji lta ba bzhin du thar pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: gang las ji lta ba bzhin du thar pa'i lam ston to //
translated: He teaches the path of liberation just as it is, from which there is deliverance.

original: stobs nyid ni 'di dag gi phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud tshar gcod pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs nyid ni 'di dag gi phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud tshar gcod pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: The power of these powers is distinguished by the destruction of the aggregates, the defilements, the son of god, and the demon of death.

original: khyad par ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas bar chad mi byed pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi bar thams cad du dri ba dris na dri ba lung ston pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas bar chad mi byed pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi bar thams cad du dri ba dris na dri ba lung ston pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction is that, having abandoned the obscurations of the knowable, he is unobstructed in answering questions, from the question of what is possible and what is impossible up to the question of the destruction of the impurities.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis ni 'khor gyi nang du bdag ston pa yang dag pa bdag dang gzhan la phan par zhugs pa nyid du yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis ni 'khor gyi nang du bdag ston pa yang dag pa bdag dang gzhan la phan par zhugs pa nyid du yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
translated: By means of the four forms of intrepidity, he correctly establishes himself as a true teacher for his followers, having attained the benefit of self and the benefit of others.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nas lam gyi bar la rgol ba'i mu stegs can rnams chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nas lam gyi bar la rgol ba'i mu stegs can rnams chos dang mthun pas tshar gcod do //
translated: By means of the knowledge of what is proper and improper, he is able to refute all the adversaries of the path, from the attainment of perfect enlightenment up to the end of the realm of samsara.🔽By means of the four forms of correct knowledge, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the addictions of attachment, etc., to those who listen to him with devotion, etc.🔽By means of the four forms of fearlessness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis ni gus par nyan pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas tshogs yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyis ni gus par nyan pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas tshogs yongs su sdud do //
translated: By means of the four forms of intrepidity, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.

original: bsrung ba med pa rnams kyis ni rang gi nyes pa brjod du dogs nas bsrung ba med pa'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs la 'doms so //
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa rnams kyis ni rang gi nyes pa brjod du dogs nas bsrung ba med pa'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs la 'doms so //
translated: By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is able to attract a following, because he is free of the fear of being unable to teach the Dharma to his followers, etc.🔽By means of the three foundations of mindfulness, he is

original: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis ni sems can gyi don bya ba nye bar gnas pa la skad cig tsam yang bag med pas 'gal bar mi mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis ni sems can gyi don bya ba nye bar gnas pa la skad cig tsam yang bag med pas 'gal bar mi mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'dor ro //
translated: By the reality of non-forgetfulness, he does not abandon the deeds of a Buddha, because he does not contradict the opportunity to act for the welfare of sentient beings even for a moment through heedlessness.

original: bag chags legs par bcom pas ni de ltar dgra bcom pa las 'khrul pa la sogs pa ston pa lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: bag chags legs par bcom pas ni de ltar dgra bcom pa las 'khrul pa la sogs pa ston pa lta bu ma yin te /
translated: By the thorough conquest of the instinct for the afflictions, he does not show the kind of behavior that would be like the mistakes of an Arhat.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas /
translated: By the absence of afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa lta bu'i spyod pa mi ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lta bu'i spyod pa mi ston to //
translated: he does not show the kind of behavior that would be like the afflictions.

original: thugs rje chen pos ni su nyams par 'gyur su 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so sor rtog pa'i phyir nyin mtshan lan drug du 'jig rten rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos ni su nyams par 'gyur su 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so sor rtog pa'i phyir nyin mtshan lan drug du 'jig rten rnam par gzigs so //
translated: By great compassion, he sees the world with his vision of omniscience six times during the day and night, in order to discern such things as who is declining and who is flourishing.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams mkhyen pa nyid kyis ni thams cad du ye shes thogs pa med pas sems can thams cad kyi the @101a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // rnam pa thams mkhyen pa nyid kyis ni thams cad du ye shes thogs pa med pas sems can thams cad kyi the @101a * //
translated: The special qualities of the Buddha are to be connected with the definition of the uncommon, completely pure, and fully mastered activities of body, speech, and mind, as in the section on the definition of the ten masteries.

original: tshom gcod do //
analyzed: tshom gcod do //
translated: By means of the knowledge of all aspects, he has unobstructed knowledge of everything, and so he cuts through the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: the tshom bcad pa'i phyir de dang der bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i rim gyis yang dag par bsdus nas chos kyi tshul yang yun ring du 'jog go //
analyzed: the tshom bcad pa'i phyir de dang der bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs rnams yang dag par bsdus pa'i rim gyis yang dag par bsdus nas chos kyi tshul yang yun ring du 'jog go //
translated: In order to cut through doubts, he gathers together the various Dharma teachings that have been taught, and by the process of gathering them together, he establishes the way of the Dharma for a long time.

original: chos kyi tshul de la brten nas sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni yongs su smin par mdzad /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul de la brten nas sems can yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni yongs su smin par mdzad /
translated: Relying on that way of the Dharma, he brings to maturity those sentient beings who are not yet mature,

original: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar mdzad do //
translated: and he liberates those who are mature.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam thob nas lam dman pa 'dor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam thob nas lam dman pa 'dor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having attained the path of distinction, the abandonment of the inferior path is as follows.

original: 'bras bus bsdus pa'i lam thob par gyur na 'jug pa'i lam rnam par 'dor zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bus bsdus pa'i lam thob par gyur na 'jug pa'i lam rnam par 'dor zhes bya ste /
translated: When one attains the path subsumed by the fruit, one abandons the path of entry.

original: yang mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yang mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because one does not actualize it again.

original: / bsdoms te spong ba yang mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu thob pa'i dus te /
analyzed: / bsdoms te spong ba yang mngon sum du byed do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu thob pa'i dus te /
translated: The abandonment of the sum total is actualized. This is the time of attaining the fruit,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i rigs kyi nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pas gnas gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i rigs kyi nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pas gnas gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains the special transformation of the basis through completely abandoning all the negative tendencies of the class of afflictions that are incompatible with it.

original: rgyun yang dag par gcod pa'i rnam par 'dor bas rnam par spong zhes bya ba ni gtan du kun du mi spyod pas rnam par 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyun yang dag par gcod pa'i rnam par 'dor bas rnam par spong zhes bya ba ni gtan du kun du mi spyod pas rnam par 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One abandons through the complete severance of the continuum. This is because one abandons through never engaging in it again.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar rnam bar spong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar rnam bar spong ba ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva does not abandon in this way.

original: de'i lam ni sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa sngon du btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lam ni sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa sngon du btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its path is the intention to lead all sentient beings to nirvana.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa dang yon tan mi zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa dang yon tan mi zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the roots of virtue and the qualities of bodhisattvas are said to be inexhaustible.

original: 'di ltar blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las mi zad pa bstan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las mi zad pa bstan pa rnams yin no //
translated: Thus, the inexhaustible topics are taught in the Sutra Taught by Aksayamati.

original: 'jig rten rtag pa'o mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dri ba la lung mi ston pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni don dang mi ldan pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa'o mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dri ba la lung mi ston pa'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa ni don dang mi ldan pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The classification of things that are not to be declared in response to questions such as “Is the world permanent or impermanent?” is not proper because it is meaningless.

original: 'dri ba de dag gi 'dri ba'i don dang ldan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'dri ba de dag gi 'dri ba'i don dang ldan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the questions that are to be declared?

original: 'di lta ste 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las brtsams nas gang 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las brtsams nas gang 'dri ba ste /
translated: It is the meaning that begins with the four noble truths.

original: 'di ltar de rgyu dang 'bras bu dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i sems pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
