analyzed: 'di ltar de rgyu dang 'bras bu dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i sems pa'i nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is included among the volitions of cause, effect, affliction, and purification.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs kyang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs par rnam par mi gzhag pa ni mi gnas pa'i lam thob pas rgyun la 'jug pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs kyang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs par rnam par mi gzhag pa ni mi gnas pa'i lam thob pas rgyun la 'jug pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one has entered into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva, one is not classified as a stream-winner, etc., because the attainment of the non-abiding path is not yet fully accomplished.

original: shes bya ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: shes bya ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The knowable is sixfold:

original: 'khrul ba nas ma 'khrul pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'khrul ba nas ma 'khrul pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from error up to the conformity with non-error.

original: de la 'khrul @101b pa ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khrul @101b pa ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Therein, error is the adherence to the grasped and the grasper.

original: 'khrul pa'i gnas ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul 'du byed kyi rgyu tsam yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba gang la byis pa rnams gang mngon par zhen pas 'jug go //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i gnas ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul 'du byed kyi rgyu tsam yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur ba gang la byis pa rnams gang mngon par zhen pas 'jug go //
translated: The basis of error is the mere cause of the formative forces which is the domain of the noble wisdom, but which is imagined to be the nature of the unreal, in regard to which the foolish engage in adherence.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i gnas ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i gnas ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The basis of non-error is thusness.

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of nonconceptual intuition.

original: 'khrul pa yang yin la ma 'khrul ba yang yin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang yin la ma 'khrul ba yang yin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa thos pa las byung ba la sogs pa dge ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: That which is both erroneous and nonerroneous is the mundane intuition that is consistent with supramundane intuition, and the virtuous qualities that arise from hearing, etc.

original: shes bya ba rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya ba rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are consistent with the nonconceptual intuition that knows the way things really are and the conceptual intuition that knows the way things conventionally are.

original: ma 'khrul pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Nonerroneous is the nonconceptual intuition.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i rgyu mthun pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i rgyu mthun pa ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The cause consistent with nonerroneous is the virtuous qualities that are attained subsequent to the noble path.

original: thabs la mkhas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Skill in means is fourfold.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la mkhas pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ste /
translated: Skill in ripening refers to the four persuasions,

original: de dag gis bsdus nas dge ba rnams la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus nas dge ba rnams la 'dzud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having attracted them by those persuasions, one introduces them to virtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mkhas pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is skill in perfecting the qualities of a buddha.🔽The bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to perfect the perfections from generosity

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par byed par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to omniscience should train in just this perfection of wisdom.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba la mkhas pas ni nyid mtshan lan drug tu sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang ; sangs rgyas la gsol ba btab pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba la mkhas pas ni nyid mtshan lan drug tu sdig pa bshags pa dang / bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba dang ; sangs rgyas la gsol ba btab pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: Skill in swift superknowledge is the six times daily confession of sins, rejoicing in merit, supplicating the buddhas, and dedicating roots of virtue.

original: 'phags pa byams pas zhus pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas zhus pa las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as taught in the Questions of Maitreya.

original: lam rgyun mi 'chad pa'i mkhas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas phyir zhing rgyun mi 'chad par gtan du 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'dul pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun du ston pa'i phyir
analyzed: lam rgyun mi 'chad pa'i mkhas pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas phyir zhing rgyun mi 'chad par gtan du 'jig rten gyi khams kun du 'dul pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun du ston pa'i phyir
translated: The wise who are uninterrupted in the path are uninterrupted in the world for a long time through nonabiding nirvana, and they always display the deeds of buddhas and bodhisattvas in all worldly realms in accordance with the training of beings.

original: ro // yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: ro // yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: Unreal ideation is of ten kinds.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste /🔽rnam par rtog pa thams cad @102a * //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ste / rnam par rtog pa thams cad @102a * //
translated: The fundamental ideation is the store consciousness,

original: kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi sa bon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the seed of all ideations.

original: mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni lus dang gnas dang / longs spyod kyi rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni lus dang gnas dang / longs spyod kyi rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The ideation of signs is the representations of the body, the place, and the enjoyments,

original: gzung ba dang mtshan mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang mtshan mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the apprehended object and the sign.

original: de dag ni dbang po gzugs can dang snod kyi 'jig rten dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid dang go rims bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dbang po gzugs can dang snod kyi 'jig rten dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi mtshan nyid dang go rims bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: These should be understood in the same order as the characteristics of the material faculties, the physical cosmos, and the objects such as form.

original: mtshan mar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang yid de gzung ba'i mtshan ma ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang yid de gzung ba'i mtshan ma ji skad du bshad pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conceptualization that appears as signs is the six consciousnesses and the manas, because they are the transformation of the signs of the object as they have been explained.

original: mtshan mar gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i lus la sogs ba'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa gzhan du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar gyur pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i lus la sogs ba'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa gzhan du bskyed pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization that is a sign is the production of the other aspects of the signs of the body, etc., as they have been explained.

original: mtshan mar snang bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mtshan mar snang ba ji skad du bstan pa dag bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar snang bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mtshan mar snang ba ji skad du bstan pa dag bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs gzhan du bskyed pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization that appears as signs is the production of the other states of pleasure, etc., of the appearance of signs as they have been explained in the visual consciousness, etc.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bstan par bsdus pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bstan par bsdus pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The discursive thought taught by others is characterized by the collection of names, words, and letters that are included in the teaching.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is also twofold:

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi bdag nyid dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi bdag nyid dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos kyi tshul gyi bdag nyid do //
translated: that which has the nature of the method of teaching the Dharma wrongly, and that which has the nature of the method of teaching the Dharma rightly.

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas pa yid la byed pas bsdus pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / tshul bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas pa yid la byed pas bsdus pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / tshul bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the discursive thought that is included in attention is, respectively, the nondiscursive thought and the discursive thought that are governed by those two.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las lta bar song ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa las lta bar song ba drug cu rtsa gnyis su bsdus pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The discursive thought of adherence is the discursive thought that is included in the sixty-two convictions that arise from nondiscursive thought.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa las dngos po med pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin gyi rnam par rtog pa las dngos po med pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Distraction is the conceptualization that apprehends non-entities, etc., which is the opposite of proper conceptualization.

original: de yang rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: It is of ten kinds:

original: dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa nas don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa nas don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i bar du'o //
translated: conceptualization of non-entities, etc., up to conceptualization of names as entities just as they are.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di bcu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las thog mar bstan pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di bcu ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las thog mar bstan pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: These ten conceptualizations should be understood as taught at the beginning in the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: ji skad du sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid yod bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
analyzed: ji skad du sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid yod bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong //
translated: As it is said, “Here, Śāriputra, the bodhisattva does not see the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang @102b dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang @102b dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: does not see the name of the bodhisattva,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /🔽spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: They do not see awakening.🔽They do not see ‘practice.’

original: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see ‘not practice.’

original: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Because a name is empty of the essence of a name.

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not empty of emptiness.

original: gzugs ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Form is empty of the essence of form.

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not empty of emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du ngo bo nyid kyis ni stong ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du ngo bo nyid kyis ni stong ste /
translated: Consciousness is empty of the essence of consciousness.

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not empty of emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no //
translated: the emptiness of form is not form.

original: stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin no //🔽gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin no // gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.🔽Form is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness is form.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The same applies up to consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub ces bya ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming zhes bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / byang chub ces bya ba dang / gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni ming tsam ste /
translated: The so-called name of a bodhisattva, the so-called bodhisattva, the so-called perfection of wisdom, the so-called awakening, and the so-called form up to the so-called consciousness are mere names.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin //
translated: They are essentially unborn and unceasing, not defiled,

original: rnam par byang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma yin no //
translated: and not purified.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skye ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni skye ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nas /
translated: A bodhisattva practicing the perfection of wisdom does not see arising,

original: rnam par byang ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: up to does not see purification.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor brtags nas /
analyzed: ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor brtags nas /
translated: Having investigated those phenomena in a fabricated name,

original: glo bur gyi ming gis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur gyi ming gis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conventional designation is made by means of a nominal designation.

original: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to //
translated: As much as there is a conventional designation, to that extent there is an adherence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni ming thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni ming thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva does not see any name at all.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: Since he does not see, he does not adhere.

original: de la dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to remedy the conceptualization of non-entity, it is said: “The bodhisattva exists.”

original: yod pa'i sgra ni dngos po'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i sgra ni dngos po'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the word “exists” has the meaning of entity.🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of entity, it is said: “The bodhisattva does not see.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of non-entity, it is said: “The bodhisattva does not see the bodhisattva.”

original: dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nas /
analyzed: dngos por rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba nas /
translated: In order to remedy the conceptualization of the bodhisattva, it is said: “He does not see form, etc.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the aggregates, it is said: “He does not see the eye, etc.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the sense bases, it is said: “He does not see the eye element, etc.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the realms, it is said: “He does not see the eye consciousness element, etc.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the aggregates, sense bases, and realms, it is said: “He does not see the eye, form, and eye consciousness, etc.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the three, it is said: “He does not see the past, future, and present.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of time, it is said: “He does not see the conditioned element.”

original: mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /🔽gang zag dang chos @103a * //
analyzed: mi spyod do zhes bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /🔽gang zag dang chos @103a * //
translated: In order to remedy the conceptualization of the unconditioned, it is said: “He does not see the unconditioned element.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the conditioned and unconditioned, it is said: “He does not see the conditioned and unconditioned elements.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the conditioned and unconditioned, it is said: “He does not see the conditioned and unconditioned elements.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the conditioned and unconditioned, it is said: “He does not see the conditioned and unconditioned elements.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the conditioned and unconditioned, it is said: “He does not see the conditioned and unconditioned elements.”🔽In order to remedy the conceptualization of the conditioned and unconditioned, it is said: “

original: kyi dngos po bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi dngos po bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of the name is refuted.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por 'di ltar ming ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por 'di ltar ming ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to the conceptualization of superimposition is stated thus: “The name is empty of intrinsic reality.”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the imagined intrinsic reality of the unreal is refuted.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to the conceptualization of denial is stated thus: “Not by emptiness.”

original: ming de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de dang bral ba nyid du thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de dang bral ba nyid du thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the name exists in all respects as being free from that imagined intrinsic reality.

original: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs
translated: The antidote to the conceptualization of identity is stated thus: “The emptiness of form is not form,” and so on up to “The emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.”

original: te / ngo bo nyid gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: te / ngo bo nyid gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Because it is not a different intrinsic reality, form, etc. are the imagined reality.

original: stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the perfected reality.

original: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: As an antidote to the discrimination of difference, it is said: Form is not different from emptiness.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form itself is emptiness.🔽Emptiness itself is form.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: This is stated up to consciousness.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Because it is the characteristic of the imagined reality.

original: de las ma gtogs par de med pa'i phyir ro //🔽ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs par de med pa'i phyir ro // ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por 'di lta ste /
translated: Because it does not exist apart from that.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: As an antidote to the discrimination of intrinsic reality, it is said: This is just a name, i.e., from form up to consciousness.

original: brjod pa las ma gtogs par brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa las ma gtogs par brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from the expression, there is no intrinsic reality of the expression.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In particular, the antidote to conceptualization is the statement, “It does not arise by way of its intrinsic nature.”🔽

original: rnam par byang ba yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: In particular, as an antidote to conceptualization, it is said that “they do not see origination by way of its own being, up to they do not see purification.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of the distinctions of origination, etc. are refuted.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor brtags nas glo bur gyi ming gis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor brtags nas glo bur gyi ming gis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: As an antidote to conceptualizing the meaning in accordance with the name, it is said that “having investigated those dharmas in the fabricated name, they are merely nominally designated by adventitious names, etc.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong do //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa'i ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong do //
translated: As an antidote to conceptualizing the name in accordance with the meaning, it is said that “the bodhisattva does not see any of those names,

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba gsungs @103b te ;
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba gsungs @103b te ;
translated: and because he does not see them, he does not settle down on them.”

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du mi mthong na mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du mi mthong na mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not see a name as it really is, then one does not have a strong attachment to it.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Non-conceptuality is threefold:

original: chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: non-conceptuality of satisfaction, etc.

original: de la so so'i skye bo rnams ni gang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa chos nyid 'ga' zhig las brtsams nas sems pa mthar khrid de /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo rnams ni gang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa chos nyid 'ga' zhig las brtsams nas sems pa mthar khrid de /
translated: Therein, the worldlings, having begun with some dharma-nature such as impermanence, etc., lead the mind to the end.

original: 'di ni de bzhin no zhes nges par 'byed cing yongs su tshim pa thob par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin no zhes nges par 'byed cing yongs su tshim pa thob par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They say, This is just so, and they attain satisfaction.

original: de dag gi de ni chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi de ni chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: That is called the non-conceptuality of satisfaction.

original: de la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, non-conceptuality means the cutting off of all conceptualization.

original: nyan thos rnams ni phung po rnams la rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log gi gnyen por ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la chos tsam du yongs su brtags pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni phung po rnams la rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log gi gnyen por ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la chos tsam du yongs su brtags pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pas bdag med par rtogs te /
translated: The Listeners, as an antidote to the error of permanence, etc. with regard to the personality aggregates, etc. realize selflessness by means of supramundane cognition, through thorough examination of form, etc. as mere phenomena, just as they are.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi ni de phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi ni de phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that is called their non-imagination in the aspect of non-error.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs la sogs pa chos tsam de yang spros par rig nas chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnam par bshig ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs la sogs pa chos tsam de yang spros par rig nas chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnam par bshig ste /
translated: The Bodhisattvas, having understood that mere phenomena such as form, etc. are also conceptual elaboration, destroy the signs of all phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes mchog tu zhi bas de bzhin nyid thams cad du 'gro ba rtogs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes mchog tu zhi bas de bzhin nyid thams cad du 'gro ba rtogs te /
translated: By means of the supreme peace of supramundane gnosis, they realize the suchness that extends everywhere.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi de ni spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi de ni spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that is called their non-imagination that is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: ji ltar na de spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya zhe na gal te yid la byed pa med pas de skad bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na de spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya zhe na gal te yid la byed pa med pas de skad bya ba ni /
translated: If it is so called because of the absence of mental activity,

original: des na gnyid kyis log pa dang / ra ro pha la sogs pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gnyid kyis log pa dang / ra ro pha la sogs pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then even one who is asleep, drunk, and so on would be non-conceptual,

original: de dag la chos kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la chos kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mental activity of the signs of the Dharma is absent in them.

original: ji ste yang dag par 'das pas de skad bya na ni des na bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste yang dag par 'das pas de skad bya na ni des na bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is so called because of transcending, then all the second concentration and so on would be non-conceptual,

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they transcend the conceptualization of investigation and analysis.

original: de'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa'i lus ni khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa'i lus ni khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'di dang 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, it contradicts the statement, “The body of conceptualization is the mind and mental factors of the three realms.”

original: ji ste rnam par zhi bas de skad bya na ni /
analyzed: ji ste rnam par zhi bas de skad bya na ni /
translated: But if it is so called because of complete pacification,

original: des na 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /🔽der sems dang @104a * //
analyzed: des na 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te / der sems dang @104a * //
translated: Therefore, the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation would also be non-conceptual,

original: sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conceptualization of mind and mental factors is completely pacified there.

original: de'i phyir shes pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, consciousness would not exist.

original: ji ste ngo bo nyid kyis de skad bya na ni /
analyzed: ji ste ngo bo nyid kyis de skad bya na ni /
translated: If it is so described because of its intrinsic reality,

original: des na gzugs kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gzugs kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then form would also be non-conceptual,

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the intrinsic reality of non-conceptuality.

original: ji ste dmigs pa la mngon bar 'du byed pa med pas de skad bya na ni /
analyzed: ji ste dmigs pa la mngon bar 'du byed pa med pas de skad bya na ni /
translated: If it is so described because of the absence of the formative influence of an objective support,

original: des rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then that which is conceptual would be non-conceptual,

original: 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes mngon par 'du byed pa 'di ni mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes mngon par 'du byed pa 'di ni mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the formative influence of the notion that this is non-conceptual is a characteristic of conceptualization in regard to signs.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa de dag gis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi blta ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa de dag gis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi blta ste /
translated: Therefore, one should not view nonconceptuality in terms of those aspects.

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa nyid du blta'o //
translated: However, one should view it as the absence of the formation of an objective mental image.

original: ji ltar zhe na gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi gdams pa la brten nas /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi gdams pa la brten nas /
translated: How so? When the bodhisattva, on the basis of the instruction in accordance with reality,

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su ma grub par rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su ma grub par rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: contemplates the signs of all phenomena as unreal by nature,

original: rnam par rtog pa de la goms pa'i stobs bskyed pas so so rang gis mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du spros pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de la goms pa'i stobs bskyed pas so so rang gis mngon bar 'du byed pa med pa nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du spros pa med pa'i chos kyi dbyings chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
translated: and by the power of being habituated to that contemplation, he or she settles the mind in the reality of all phenomena, the unelaborated realm of truth, just as it is, by means of the absence of the formation of an objective mental image.

original: de ni de'i spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s unelaborated nonconceptuality.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po zhes sngar bshad na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po zhes sngar bshad na /
translated: Since it was explained above that the bodhisattva is by nature of sharp faculties,

original: de ji ltar dus dus su dbang po rnams sbyang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dus dus su dbang po rnams sbyang bar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one purify the faculties at the appropriate time?

original: rang gi rigs kyi dbang po rtul po la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrubs pas de sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi dbang po rtul po la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrubs pas de sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that one applies oneself to the purification of the faculties by means of the three types of faculties, weak, etc., of one's own lineage, by means of the higher and higher realizations.

original: gzhan du na dbang po rnon po'i rigs rnams kyi dbang po rnams rnam pa gcig tu gyur na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na dbang po rnon po'i rigs rnams kyi dbang po rnams rnam pa gcig tu gyur na ni /
translated: Otherwise, if the faculties of those of sharp faculties were of one type,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang por gyur pa'i khyad par mi dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang por gyur pa'i khyad par mi dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: the distinction of the faculties of the bodhisattvas would not be evident.

original: de yang dmigs pa de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa de grub bo /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa de grub bo /
translated: But since that is evident, what has been stated is established.

original: // / bo ma po bcu pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: // / bo ma po bcu pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: This concludes the tenth chapter, on the faculties, in this Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, a commentary on the scriptures of the universal vehicle.

original: 'bel ba'i gtam gyi rnam par nges pa bdun la don rnam par nges pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi don la sogs pa don drug las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bel ba'i gtam gyi rnam par nges pa bdun la don rnam par nges pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi don la sogs pa don drug las brtsams par rig par bya'o //
translated: The sevenfold ascertainment of the discussion is to be understood as beginning with the six topics, the topic of reality, etc.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi don ni ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi don ni ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
translated: Among them, the topic of reality is the three realities.

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs @104b su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs @104b su grub pa'o //
translated: the imagined, the other-dependent, and the reality.

original: rgyu'i don ni rgyu gsum ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i don ni rgyu gsum ste /
translated: The meaning of cause is threefold:

original: skye ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of origination is the four conditions,

original: rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnams te /
analyzed: rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnams te /
translated: which are the causal condition, the immediately preceding condition, the objective condition, and the dominant condition.

original: de la 'dus byas thams cad grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas thams cad grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of them, all that is conditioned comes into existence.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of manifestation is the twelve limbs of existence,

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis mthar gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis mthar gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: from “with ignorance as condition, the formative forces” up to “with birth as condition, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anxiety come into existence.”

original: 'grub pa'i rgyu ni mngon sum du dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa mtshungs pa sro bsnyad pas bsdus pas te /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i rgyu ni mngon sum du dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa mtshungs pa sro bsnyad pas bsdus pas te /
translated: The cause of accomplishment is the five results,

original: des bsgrub par ma grags pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub par ma grags pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of which the accomplishment of the desired object is achieved.

original: 'bras bu'i don ni 'bras bu lnga ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don ni 'bras bu lnga ste /
translated: The meaning of result is fivefold:

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ripened result is as follows:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result that corresponds to the cause is as follows:

original: sdar skyes pa'i dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de'i rgyu las byung ba dge ba la sogs pa chos phyi ma rnams so //
analyzed: sdar skyes pa'i dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de'i rgyu las byung ba dge ba la sogs pa chos phyi ma rnams so //
translated: later phenomena that are virtuous and so on, which arise from the causes of the virtuous and so on that arose previously.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The dominant result is as follows:

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: the external world, which is the result of the shared karma of all sentient beings.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of conscious effort is as follows:

original: lo tog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo tog la sogs pa'o //
translated: crops and so on.🔽The result of separation is as follows:

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'o //
translated: the complete destruction of the latent tendencies of the ārya path.

original: las kyi don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: las kyi don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of karma is as follows:

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching on the afflictions of karma.

original: ldan pa'i don ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ldan pa'i don ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The meaning of possession is fivefold:

original: mang po las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mang po las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Possession that arises from many is as follows:

original: khang pa'i shing dang pha gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khang pa'i shing dang pha gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: the wood and nails of a house and so on.

original: rjes su 'ching ba las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'ching ba las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Subsequent possession that arises from bondage is as follows.

original: bag la nyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The possession that results from bondage is the cause of latent tendencies, etc.

original: 'di ltar de yod na kun du mi spyod kyang nyon mongs pa sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽'brel par gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de yod na kun du mi spyod kyang nyon mongs pa sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o // 'brel par gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: For when they exist, one is said to be possessed of the passions, even though one does not indulge in them.

original: rang gi skye bo rnams phan tshun 'brel pa'o //🔽gnas skabs las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang gi skye bo rnams phan tshun 'brel pa'o // gnas skabs las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The possession that results from association is, for example, the mutual association of one’s own people.

original: phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi gnas skabs te ;🔽/'di ltar de'i 'phral du bde ba dang ldan pa nas /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyi gnas skabs te ; /'di ltar de'i 'phral du bde ba dang ldan pa nas /
translated: The possession that results from condition is the condition of the stream of consciousness that is helpful, etc.🔽For when it exists, one is said to be possessed of pleasure, etc.,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i bar du ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽'gyur ba las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i bar du ldan pa zhes bya'o // 'gyur ba las gyur pa'i ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: up to and including the possession of neither pleasure nor suffering.

original: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mngon du gyur pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The possession that results from transformation is the manifest transformation of the adventitious secondary passions, etc.

original: de yod na 'dod @105a * //
analyzed: de yod na 'dod @105a * //
translated: For when it exists, one is said to be possessed of the passions, etc.

original: chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One is said to be endowed with attachment, etc., and with faith, etc.

original: 'jug pa'i don ni 'jug pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don ni 'jug pa lnga ste /
translated: The meaning of engagement is fivefold:

original: mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ni skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ni skye ba la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum ste /
translated: Engagement in the characteristics refers to the three characteristics of the conditioned, i.e., arising, etc.,

original: de dag gi rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the originators of the aspects of those.

original: rten la 'jug pa ni rten la gnas par bya ba gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rten la 'jug pa ni rten la gnas par bya ba gnas pa ste /
translated: Engagement in the basis refers to the basis, i.e., enduring, because it is that which causes the basis to endure.

original: 'di ltar sa la sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la sems can rnams so //
translated: Thus, sentient beings are on the earth.

original: phyin ci log gi 'jug pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi 'jug pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: Engagement in error refers to the dharmas of affliction,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage in what is not as it is.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i 'jug pa ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i 'jug pa ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: Engagement in non-error refers to the noble path,

original: de phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages in what is as it is.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa ni chos rnams kyi rnam pa tha dad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa ni chos rnams kyi rnam pa tha dad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Engagement in differentiation refers to the various aspects of the dharmas.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang nang dang phyi la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed thams cad 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang nang dang phyi la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, all formations are included in the past, future, and present, and in the internal and external, etc.

original: rnam par bshad pa rnam par des pa ni gang gis mdo sde rnams kyi don ston pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rnam par des pa ni gang gis mdo sde rnams kyi don ston pa ste /
translated: The clear explanation is that by which the meaning of the sutras is taught.

original: de yang yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po la sogs pa don drug po dag mdo sde so sor ji ltar mthun mthun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po la sogs pa don drug po dag mdo sde so sor ji ltar mthun mthun du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because the six topics, the things to be fully known, etc., are taught in each sutra according to their relevance.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the things to be fully known are the aggregates, etc.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning to be fully known is impermanence, etc.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu ni tshul khrims dang dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu ni tshul khrims dang dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of full knowledge is morality and the restraint of the sense faculties, etc.

original: yongs su shes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: Full knowledge is the factors of enlightenment.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The result of full knowledge is liberation.

original: de rab tu shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de rab tu shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of that is the seeing of the pristine wisdom of liberation.

original: yang rnam par bshad pa'i sgo bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par bshad pa'i sgo bcu bzhi ste /
translated: There are also fourteen doors of explanation.

original: rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba'i sgo ni gang na mdo sde 'byung ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / dgongs pa dang / brgal ba dang / lan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba'i sgo ni gang na mdo sde 'byung ba'i dgos pa dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / dgongs pa dang / brgal ba dang / lan brjod pa'o //
translated: The door of explanation that is a summary is that which shows the purpose of the arising of the sūtras, the meaning of the words, the connection, the intention, the objections, and the replies.

original: dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo ni gang na mdo sde bslab pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po la sogs par ston pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo ni gang na mdo sde bslab pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po la sogs par ston pa ste /
translated: The door of explanation that is a summary of things is that which teaches the sūtras in terms of the trainings, the ārya truths, things, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: Do not commit any evil,

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: Practice virtue well,

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su 'dul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su 'dul //
translated: Fully tame your mind:

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes @105b bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes @105b bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This verse is in terms of the three trainings and so on.

original: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag gi sgo ni gang du tshig gcig gis bstan pa la lhag ma rnams kyis bshad do zhes rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag gi sgo ni gang du tshig gcig gis bstan pa la lhag ma rnams kyis bshad do zhes rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: The method of the branches and the minor branches is that one verse teaches and the remaining verses explain.

original: dper na dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa bcu gnyis bstan pa las bdag phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis go rims bzhin du tshig 'og ma lnga lngas bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa bcu gnyis bstan pa las bdag phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis go rims bzhin du tshig 'og ma lnga lngas bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, in the teaching of the twelve perfections of leisure and opportunity, the two verses “perfection of self” and “perfection of others” are respectively explained by the five verses that follow.

original: 'di lta ste mi nyid dang / yul dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po rnams ma tshang ba med pa dang / las kyi mtha' smin par ma gyur pa dag gnas su gyur pa la dad pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi nyid dang / yul dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po rnams ma tshang ba med pa dang / las kyi mtha' smin par ma gyur pa dag gnas su gyur pa la dad pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang /
translated: They are: being a human, being born in a central land, having complete faculties, having proper motivation, having faith in the correct object, the appearance of buddhas,

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / bstan pa'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan la snying brtse ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / bstan pa'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / gnas pa'i chos rnams kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan la snying brtse ba'o //
translated: the teaching of the sublime Dharma, the endurance of the taught Dharma, following the enduring Dharma, and having compassion for others.

original: gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo ni gong du 'og ma ni gong ma la mngon bar bsgrub pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir chos de dag ni de ltar bstan to zhes ston pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo ni gong du 'og ma ni gong ma la mngon bar bsgrub pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir chos de dag ni de ltar bstan to zhes ston pa'o //
translated: The door of higher and higher achievement is taught in order to show that the higher is the basis of the achievement of the lower.

original: dper na dbang po lnga po rnams te 'di ltar dang na brtson 'grus brtsom mo //🔽brtson 'grus brtsams na dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: dper na dbang po lnga po rnams te 'di ltar dang na brtson 'grus brtsom mo // brtson 'grus brtsams na dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: For example, the five faculties, because faith is the basis of the achievement of vigor, etc.🔽When there is vigor, mindfulness is established.

original: dran ba nye bar gnas na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: dran ba nye bar gnas na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: When mindfulness is established, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya'o //
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows and sees things as they really are.

original: spong ba'i sgo ni 'di las brtsams nas 'di spong bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i sgo ni 'di las brtsams nas 'di spong bar ston pa ste /
translated: The door of elimination is taught in order to show the elimination of this and that, beginning with this.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ste'u yu lta bu'i mdo las zag pa zad pa las brtsams nas 'di las phyi rol pa dang / chos 'di ba thos pa dang sems pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / bsgom pas yongs su yi chad pa dang / tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ste'u yu lta bu'i mdo las zag pa zad pa las brtsams nas 'di las phyi rol pa dang / chos 'di ba thos pa dang sems pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dang / bsgom pas yongs su yi chad pa dang / tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The Sutra on the Small Nail, beginning with the exhaustion of the contaminants, rejects four kinds of persons: those outside this doctrine, those who are satisfied with mere learning and reflection on this doctrine, those who despair of cultivating meditation, and those who do not complete the collections.

original: dge slong dag nga ni shes bzhin mthong bzhin du zag pa rnams zad par smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gi dum bus dang po'i gang zag spangs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag nga ni shes bzhin mthong bzhin du zag pa rnams zad par smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gi dum bus dang po'i gang zag spangs so //
translated: The first person is rejected by the words of the sutra, “Monks, I declare that the contaminants are exhausted through knowledge and insight.”

original: sgom par sbyor ba la brtson pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa spangs so //
analyzed: sgom par sbyor ba la brtson pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa spangs so //
translated: The second is rejected by the words, “Those who are diligent in applying themselves to meditation.”

original: ste yu'i dpes ni gsum pa spangs so //
analyzed: ste yu'i dpes ni gsum pa spangs so //
translated: The third is rejected by the analogy of the small nail.

original: gru'i dpas ni bzhi pa spangs so //
analyzed: gru'i dpas ni bzhi pa spangs so //
translated: The fourth is rejected by the analogy of the boat.

original: yi ge yongs su sgyur ba'i sgo ni gang du don gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i yi ge rnams gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge yongs su sgyur ba'i sgo ni gang du don gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i yi ge rnams gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba ste /
translated: The transformation of letters is the transformation of letters that are well known to have one meaning into another.

original: dper na mi gang ma dad byas @106a * //
analyzed: dper na mi gang ma dad byas @106a * //
translated: For example, the word “man” is made from the letters ma, na, and a.

original: mig za // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig za // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the verse: The eye is empty of self and of permanence, etc.

original: chud za ba dang chud mi za ba'i sgo ni gang du rab tu chud za ba dang / rab tu chud mi za ba dang / de gnyi ga'i thabs dang / de gnyi ga'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: chud za ba dang chud mi za ba'i sgo ni gang du rab tu chud za ba dang / rab tu chud mi za ba dang / de gnyi ga'i thabs dang / de gnyi ga'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa ste /
translated: The door of loss and non-loss is the teaching of the method of both loss and non-loss and the analysis of both.

original: dper na legs par skyes kyi mdo las rab tu chud za ba ni phyi dang nang gi rdzas la lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na legs par skyes kyi mdo las rab tu chud za ba ni phyi dang nang gi rdzas la lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: For example, in the Subāhu-sūtra, loss is attachment to external and internal things.

original: de la phyi'i rdzas ni khyim dang chung ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la phyi'i rdzas ni khyim dang chung ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: There, external things are characterized by home, wife, etc.

original: nang gi rdzas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nang gi rdzas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Internal things are characterized by the five appropriated aggregates.

original: rab tu chud mi za ba ni de gnyi gal lhag par chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu chud mi za ba ni de gnyi gal lhag par chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Non-loss is freedom from attachment to both.

original: rab tu chud za ba'i thabs ni rab tu mi 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas kyang zag pa zad par bya ba la bag mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu chud za ba'i thabs ni rab tu mi 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas kyang zag pa zad par bya ba la bag mi byed pa'o //
translated: The method of loss is not going forth, and even if one goes forth, not making an effort to destroy the defilements.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chud mi za ba'i thabs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chud mi za ba'i thabs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be seen as the means of not wasting.

original: de la kye ma rigs kyi bu legs par skyes 'di ni gnyis kyis mdzes te /
analyzed: de la kye ma rigs kyi bu legs par skyes 'di ni gnyis kyis mdzes te /
translated: In this regard, “O son of good family, this one is well born and is beautiful in two ways:🔽he has gone forth, having shaved his head and face and put on the saffron robes, and he has destroyed the defilements and knows it.”

original: gang skra dang kha sphu bregs nas rab tu byung ba'i bar dang / gang zag pa zad nas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis chud mi za ba dang / de'i thabs nye bar bstan pas de las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid chud za ba dang de'i thabs bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang skra dang kha sphu bregs nas rab tu byung ba'i bar dang / gang zag pa zad nas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis chud mi za ba dang / de'i thabs nye bar bstan pas de las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid chud za ba dang de'i thabs bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows the non-wasting and its means, and the opposite of that shows wasting and its means.

original: chud mi za bar rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis rab tu bstan pa /
analyzed: chud mi za bar rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis rab tu bstan pa /
translated: A verse in prose with a melody to show the divisions of non-wasting:

original: dge slong 'di ni mdzes pa ste //🔽nye bar zhi zhing zag pa zad //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni mdzes pa ste // nye bar zhi zhing zag pa zad //
translated: “This monk is beautiful,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: peaceful, and has destroyed the defilements.”

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba dang zag pa zad pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba dang zag pa zad pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: Thus, going forth and destroying the defilements are shown.

original: zag pa zad pa de yang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa de yang /
translated: And that destruction of the defilements:

original: 'dod chags bral zhing bral ba ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral zhing bral ba ste //
translated: “Free from desire, detached,

original: nyer len med pas mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: nyer len med pas mya ngan 'das //
translated: he has attained nirvana without clinging.”

original: bdud kyi sde ni pham byas nas //
analyzed: bdud kyi sde ni pham byas nas //
translated: Having defeated the army of Mara,

original: lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pa yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he takes up his final body.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la 'dod chags dang bral nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba yang spangs pa dang / nang gi rdzas yongs su spangs par yang bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la 'dod chags dang bral nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba yang spangs pa dang / nang gi rdzas yongs su spangs par yang bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that, having become detached through the mundane path, he abandons the fetters associated with the higher realms through the supramundane path, and completely abandons the fetters associated with the lower realms.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zad pa'i skabs yin pas kyang 'di ba stan par blta'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zad pa'i skabs yin pas kyang 'di ba stan par blta'o //
translated: It should be seen that this is taught because it is the occasion for the exhaustion of cause and effect.

original: 'di las bzlog pa ni rab tu chud za ba'i bar du dbye ba bsnyad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa ni rab tu chud za ba'i bar du dbye ba bsnyad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the explanation of the classification up to complete loss.

original: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni gang du gang zag 'di snyed kyi dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs so zhes bya @106b bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni gang du gang zag 'di snyed kyi dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs so zhes bya @106b bar ston pa ste /
translated: The perspective of the classification of persons is where it is taught that this is from the perspective of this many persons.

original: dper na chu las gyur pa lta bu'i mdo las byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na chu las gyur pa lta bu'i mdo las byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like what appears in the Sūtra on What is Water-Based.

original: de ni gang zag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhir rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni gang zag gnyis dang gsum dang bzhir rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs te /
translated: This is stated with reference to the classification of persons into two, three, and four.

original: so so'i skye bo dang bden pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang bden pa mthong ba'o //
translated: They are the ordinary man and the one who has seen the truths.

original: so so'i skye bo ni gsum du rab tu phye nas bsnyad par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni gsum du rab tu phye nas bsnyad par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The ordinary man is to be understood as being classified into three:

original: dkar po ma yin pa dang / cung zad dkar ba dang / cher dkar ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po ma yin pa dang / cung zad dkar ba dang / cher dkar ba'o //
translated: the one who is not white, the slightly white, and the very white.

original: bden pa mthong ba ni bzhir rab tu dbye ste /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni bzhir rab tu dbye ste /
translated: The one who has seen the truths is classified into four:

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi ste /
translated: the four abiders in the fruit.

original: gsum ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: gsum ni slob pa'o //
translated: Three are the one still in training.

original: gcig ni mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni mi slob pa'o //
translated: One is the one no longer in training.🔽The classification is established by way of the four possibilities, etc.,

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni gang du mu bzhi la sogs pa dri ba rnams kyi don brjod pa ste /🔽dper ni mi rtag pa'i mdo las gang gis 'di legs par mthong ba des gzugs thams cad mthong ngam /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni gang du mu bzhi la sogs pa dri ba rnams kyi don brjod pa ste / dper ni mi rtag pa'i mdo las gang gis 'di legs par mthong ba des gzugs thams cad mthong ngam /
translated: where the meaning of the questions is stated.🔽For example, in the Sutra on Impermanence, there are four possibilities: “Whoever sees this well, does he see all forms?

original: gang gis gzugs thams cad mthong ba des thams cad legs par mthong ngam zhes bya ba mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs thams cad mthong ba des thams cad legs par mthong ngam zhes bya ba mu bzhi'o //
translated: Or, whoever sees all forms, does he see all well?”

original: mu dang po ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //🔽mu gnyis pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o // mu gnyis pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: The first alternative is to see the four aggregates of feeling and so on as not being reified as permanent, pure, blissful, and a self, and to see them as objects to be fully known and abandoned.🔽The second alternative is to see form as not being reified as permanent, pure, blissful, and a self, and to see it as not being an object to be fully known and abandoned.

original: mu gsum pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba yang dag par rdzes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang / yongs su spang bar bya ba yang dag par rdzes su blta ba'o //
translated: The third alternative is to see form as not being reified as permanent, pure, blissful, and a self, and to see it as an object to be fully known and abandoned.

original: mu bzhi pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang gtsang ba dang bde ba dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is to view the four aggregates of feeling, etc., as not to be fully understood and not to be abandoned, by superimposing the error of permanence, purity, pleasure, and a self upon them.

original: gzugs la mu bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la mu bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la yang rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as there are four possibilities with regard to form, so too there are four possibilities with regard to all of the aggregates of feeling, etc.

original: gang bya ba byas pa de thams cad 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: gang bya ba byas pa de thams cad 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba yin nam /
translated: Is everyone who has done what must be done unaware of any other existence?

original: gang 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes pa de thams cad bya ba byas pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes pa de thams cad bya ba byas pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Or is everyone who is unaware of any other existence one who has done what must be done?

original: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du legs par spyad pa spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo'i'o //🔽gnyis @107a * //
analyzed: mu dang po ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du legs par spyad pa spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo'i'o // gnyis @107a * //
translated: The first possibility is the ordinary man who practices good conduct as long as he lives.

original: pa ni chad par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni chad par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second is the view of annihilation, etc.🔽The third is the stream-enterer, etc.🔽The fourth is the case of the first two possibilities.

original: gsum pa ni mi slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mi slob pa'i'o //
translated: The third is that of the non-learner.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'i'o zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is that of the one who is neither a learner nor a non-learner.

original: tshul gyi sgo ni gang du tshul drug gi sa bon brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul gyi sgo ni gang du tshul drug gi sa bon brjod pa ste /
translated: The mode is that in which the seeds of the six modes are expressed.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / 'thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / 'thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The mode of reality, the mode of attainment, the mode of explanation, the mode of the abandonment of the two extremes, the mode of the inconceivable, and the mode of the implicit.

original: tshul drug po 'di dag las tshul gong ma gsum ni tshul 'og ma gsum gyis go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul drug po 'di dag las tshul gong ma gsum ni tshul 'og ma gsum gyis go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Among these six modes, the three higher modes should be understood in order through the three lower modes.

original: dper na ro myang ba'i mdo las dge slong dag gzugs la ro myong ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs nas de kho na'i don gyi tshul ston to //
analyzed: dper na ro myang ba'i mdo las dge slong dag gzugs la ro myong ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs nas de kho na'i don gyi tshul ston to //
translated: For example, in the Sūtra on Experiencing Taste, the statement, “Monks, there is experiencing taste in form,” etc., teaches the mode of reality by abandoning the extreme of deprecation and the extreme of imputation.

original: ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes bya ba 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes bya ba 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
translated: The phrase there is enjoyment, there is danger, there is escape eliminates the extreme of denial.

original: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs te /🔽phung po tsam la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs te / phung po tsam la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: The phrase from form to consciousness eliminates the extreme of fabrication.

original: rnam par byang bar zad kyi bdag ni med do zhes rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byang bar zad kyi bdag ni med do zhes rab tu bstan to //
translated: For it is taught that there is only the aggregates, which are defiled or purified, but no self.

original: dge slong dag ngas ji tsam tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar nang du 'du shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'thob pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis🔽yongs su bstan te /
