analyzed: dge slong dag ngas ji tsam tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar nang du 'du shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'thob pa'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bstan te /
translated: The phrase monks, I have perceived up to the supreme enlightenment shows the attainment of the inconceivable mode.

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba thob par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba thob par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it shows the attainment of the individual intuitive wisdom.

original: mdo 'di thams cad ni bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: mdo 'di thams cad ni bshad pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The entire sutra is to be understood as a method of explanation.

original: de yang dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood through the method of the intention.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu shes pa la dgongs nas mdo de dag bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu shes pa la dgongs nas mdo de dag bshad do //
translated: The sutras were spoken with the intention of the thing to be completely understood, the meaning to be completely understood, complete understanding, the result of complete understanding, and the thorough knowledge of that.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thing to be completely understood is form and so on.

original: yongs su shes bar bya ba'i don ni ro myang ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes bar bya ba'i don ni ro myang ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning to be completely understood is relishing and so on,

original: rnam pa des gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rnam pa des gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because that thing, form and so on, is completely understood through that aspect.

original: yongs su shes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag nga ltar gsum du bsgyur bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i shes pa'o /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag nga ltar gsum du bsgyur bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i shes pa'o /
translated: Complete understanding is the knowledge that realizes the five appropriated aggregates just as they are, through transforming them into the three.

original: yongs su shes pa'i @107b 'bras bu ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di las zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i @107b 'bras bu ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di las zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The result of complete understanding is the knowledge that, having completely understood the five appropriated aggregates, one is liberated from this world with its gods,

original: lha dang mi dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i bar las grol ba nas rnam par rab tu grol zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i bar las grol ba nas rnam par rab tu grol zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “endowed with gods and humans” is liberated, up to “completely liberated.”

original: de rab tu shes pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par nang du shes so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rab tu shes pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par nang du shes so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “He knows” means that he knows internally that he has fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i sgo ni gang du de kho na'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spong ba'i mtshan nyad dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na'i mchan nyid la sogs pa 'di dag gi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang ;
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i sgo ni gang du de kho na'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spong ba'i mtshan nyad dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na'i mchan nyid la sogs pa 'di dag gi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang ;
translated: The door of complete understanding, etc., is where, beginning with the characteristics of reality, the characteristics of complete understanding, the characteristics of abandonment, the characteristics of realization, the characteristics of cultivation, and the characteristics of reality, etc., are distinguished.

original: gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su ma shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi mtshan nyid kyis don ston pa ste /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su ma shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi mtshan nyid kyis don ston pa ste /
translated: The meaning is taught by the characteristics of the basis and the based, the characteristics of the phenomena that obstruct complete understanding and so on, the characteristics of compatible phenomena, the faults and benefits of not completely understanding and so on and completely understanding and so forth.

original: dper na ro myang ba'i mdo de nyid las 'byung ba /
analyzed: dper na ro myang ba'i mdo de nyid las 'byung ba /
translated: For example, the Sūtra on Experiencing Taste declares:

original: de la de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lngas bsdus pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lngas bsdus pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of thatness is the truth of suffering subsumed by the five appropriated aggregates.

original: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ro myang ba la sogs pas de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so ;
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ro myang ba la sogs pas de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so ;
translated: The characteristic of complete understanding is that one correctly understands thatness just as it is through experiencing taste and so on.

original: ; spang ba'i mtshan nyid dang mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten thams cad las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: ; spang ba'i mtshan nyid dang mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten thams cad las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of abandonment and the characteristic of actualization is complete liberation from all worlds.

original: sgrib pa spong ba dang gnas gyur pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa spong ba dang gnas gyur pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it eliminates the obscurations and actualizes the transformation.

original: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis len mang du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis len mang du gnas pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of cultivation is the repeated practice of the mind free from erroneous inversion.

original: rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lnga'i dbye ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of differentiation is the fivefold differentiation of the characteristic of thatness,

original: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from the form skandha up to the consciousness skandha.

original: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par gsum du rab tu dbye ste /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par gsum du rab tu dbye ste /
translated: The characteristic of complete understanding is the threefold differentiation,

original: ro myang ba la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs la nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bar la nges par 'byung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ro myang ba la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs la nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bar la nges par 'byung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: as one correctly understands the taste as taste, the danger in the danger, and the escape in the escape.

original: spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The characteristic of elimination and the characteristic of realization are differentiated as twofold,

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: liberation from the defilements and liberation from suffering.

original: de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes @108a * //🔽bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes @108a * // bya ba nas /
translated: Here, together with the gods means🔽up to together with humans and gods.

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i bar las grol ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i bar las grol ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is liberated from the entire world because it is liberated from the afflictions.

original: de bas na de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na de bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, in order to specify it, emancipation is stated.

original: 'di ltar mdo gzhan las nges par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo gzhan las nges par 'byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: Thus, in another sūtra it is said, What is emancipation?

original: gang 'dir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spang ba dang / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'dir 'dun pa dang 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spang ba dang / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags las yang dag par 'da' ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the subduing of desire and passion, the abandonment of desire and passion, the complete transcendence of desire and passion.

original: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon bar 'grub par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral na sdug bsngal las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon bar 'grub par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral na sdug bsngal las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir bral ba dang / rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, when one is free from the afflictions that bring about the actualization of future suffering, one is also liberated from suffering. In order to specify this, freedom and liberation are stated.

original: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su rab tu dbye ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su rab tu dbye ste /
translated: The characteristic of meditation is divided into two parts:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo //🔽de la phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo // de la phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni //
translated: the path of vision and the path of cultivation.

original: mthong ba'i lam ston to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ston to //
translated: With a mind free from error indicates the path of vision.

original: len mang du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: len mang du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgom pa'i lam ston to //
translated: The phrase he abides in the many indicates the path of cultivation.

original: gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas par 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the relation between the basis and what is based upon it

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'og ma gong ma'i gnas yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'og ma gong ma'i gnas yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is shown by the fact that the following characteristics, beginning with the characteristic of reality, are the basis of the preceding characteristics.🔽The characteristic of the obstruction to complete understanding, etc.

original: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de ltar gsum du bsgyur ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i mtshan nyid ni de ltar gsum du bsgyur ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi shes pa'o //
translated: is the failure to understand completely, just as it is, the three kinds of characteristics.🔽The characteristic of conformity is the analysis of the faults, etc.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du nyes dmigs la sogs par rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du nyes dmigs la sogs par rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: of these forms, etc., just as they are.

original: yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni mi grol ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni mi grol ba nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The characteristic of the disadvantage in regard to complete ignorance, etc. is non-liberation, up to the non-attainment of the supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: de las bzlog pa ni phan yon gyi mchan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni phan yon gyi mchan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the characteristic of the benefit.

original: stobs dang stobs ma yin pa'i sgo ni gang du tshig gcig ma brjod na don 'di go bar mi 'gyur bas tshig so so thams cad kyis nus pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: stobs dang stobs ma yin pa'i sgo ni gang du tshig gcig ma brjod na don 'di go bar mi 'gyur bas tshig so so thams cad kyis nus pa ston pa ste /
translated: The door of power and impotence is that by which one shows the capacity of each word, since this meaning is not understood if a single word is not uttered.

original: dper na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo las 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
analyzed: dper na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo las 'di yod pas 'di 'byung /
translated: For example, in the Pratityasamutpada Sutra, it is said: “Because this exists, that comes to be;

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skye ba ste /
translated: because the birth of this, that is born,

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: thus, with ignorance as condition, there are the karmic predispositions, and so on.

original: tshig 'di dag gi so so'i nus @108b pa ni ji ltar gang du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig 'di dag gi so so'i nus @108b pa ni ji ltar gang du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The power of each of these words should be understood as explained in the characteristics of dependent origination.

original: bzlas te brjod pa'i sgo ni gang du mdo'i tshig gcig bzung bas rgya cher don yang dag par ston pa ste /
analyzed: bzlas te brjod pa'i sgo ni gang du mdo'i tshig gcig bzung bas rgya cher don yang dag par ston pa ste /
translated: The door of repetition is where one correctly teaches the meaning extensively by retaining a single phrase of the sutra.

original: dper na chos drug dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni kha'i dbugs kyis ri'i rgyal po gangs ri yang 'thor na ro lta bu'i ma rig pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: dper na chos drug dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni kha'i dbugs kyis ri'i rgyal po gangs ri yang 'thor na ro lta bu'i ma rig pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: For example, it is like the sutra that says, A monk who possesses six qualities can shatter even the king of mountains, Mount Kailash, with his breath, not to mention ignorance, which is like a corpse.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di la dge slong dag 'di la dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin pa nas /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong dag 'di la dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin pa nas /
translated: Here, monks, a monk is skilled in generating the mind...

original: thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ...up to skilled in skillful means.

original: mdo 'di las ji ltar na dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mdo 'di las ji ltar na dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: In this sutra, how is a monk skilled in generating the mind?

original: 'di la dge slong ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas nas gnas te /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas nas gnas te /
translated: Here, a monk, having completed the four concentrations, from the one that is detached from sense objects, up to the one that is without pleasure and pain,

original: de ltar na dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: in this way, a monk is skilled in generating the mind.

original: ji ltar na dge slong sems gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong sems gnas pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in the mind remaining in equipoise?

original: 'di la dge slong ni kun du bsten pa'i rgyu'i bar gyis gang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan de gnas pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni kun du bsten pa'i rgyu'i bar gyis gang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan de gnas pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
translated: Here, a monk, by means of the cause of frequenting, makes the concentration that is conducive to decline become conducive to remaining stable.

original: de ltar na dge slong de sems gnas pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong de sems gnas pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, a monk is skilled in the mind remaining in equipoise.

original: ji ltar na dge slong de sems ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong de sems ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in the mind rising from equipoise?

original: 'di la dge slong ni kun du bsten pa'i rgyus gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan de khyad par du gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni kun du bsten pa'i rgyus gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan de khyad par du gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
translated: Here, a monk, by means of the cause of frequenting, makes the concentration that is conducive to remaining stable become conducive to distinction.

original: de ltar na dge slong ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, a monk is skilled in the mind rising from equipoise.

original: ji ltar na dge slong 'phel bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong 'phel bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in increasing?

original: 'di la dge slong ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spang ba nyid rgya cher bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spang ba nyid rgya cher bya ste /
translated: Here a monk, with regard to the wholesome factors that have not yet arisen,

original: de ltar na dge slong 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: in this way a monk is skilled in increasing.

original: ji ltar na de slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in decreasing?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis rgya cher bya ste /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis rgya cher bya ste /
translated: With regard to the unwholesome factors that have already arisen,

original: de ltar na dge slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: in this way a monk is skilled in decreasing.

original: ji ltar na dge slong thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in means?

original: 'di la dge slong ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rgya cher sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rgya cher sbyar te /
translated: Here a monk cultivates the basis of spiritual power that possesses concentration due to desire and the volitional formations that are in accordance with that,🔽in this way a monk is skilled in means.

original: de ltar na dge slong thabs la @109a * //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong thabs la @109a * //
translated: Thus, a monk who is skilled in means🔽

original: mkhas pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus a monk is skilled in means.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo ni gang du tshig re re la yang mu bzhi la sogs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo ni gang du tshig re re la yang mu bzhi la sogs pa ston pa ste /
translated: The door of clear realization is where each phrase teaches the four possibilities and so on.

original: mu bzhi pa la sogs pa la de dag gi tshig re re la yang gzhan bzhi la sogs pas thug pa med par mngon bar bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa la sogs pa la de dag gi tshig re re la yang gzhan bzhi la sogs pas thug pa med par mngon bar bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
translated: For each phrase of the four possibilities and so on, there are four others and so on, and so they are to be understood as being established without limit.

original: dper na sangs rgyas rtsom pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas rtsom pa'i mdo las /
translated: For example, the Buddha’s Activity Sūtra says:

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi byang chub yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: “These four are the dharmas that purify the enlightenment of bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: stong pa nyid sgom pa dang / sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu phan pa nye bar sgrub pa'i sems dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o zhes bya ba bzhi ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sgom pa dang / sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu phan pa nye bar sgrub pa'i sems dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o zhes bya ba bzhi ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te /
translated: The four are: the meditation on emptiness, the mind free from hostility toward any living being, the mind always intent on benefiting the bodhisattvas, and the mind of generosity with the gift of Dharma, free of desire for material reward.

original: byang chub yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: These four are to be understood as the antidotes to the four counteragents that begin with the benefit of self and other.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang / gnod sems dang / nga rgyal dang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sred pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang / gnod sems dang / nga rgyal dang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sred pa'o //
translated: The four counteragents are: the enjoyment of meditative concentration, malice, pride, and craving for material reward and honor.

original: rnams grangs gzhan du na chos dang pos ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po bstan to //
analyzed: rnams grangs gzhan du na chos dang pos ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po bstan to //
translated: In another enumeration, the first of these four is the antidote to the elimination of the afflictions.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu gsum gyis theg pa dman pa yongs su spang bar bsten te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu gsum gyis theg pa dman pa yongs su spang bar bsten te /
translated: The remaining three are the antidote to the avoidance of the lesser vehicle, which is accomplished by three causes.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis sems can thams cad nye bar 'dzin pa dang / zhugs pa yongs su smin par byed pa dang / ma zhugs pa 'jug par byed pas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis sems can thams cad nye bar 'dzin pa dang / zhugs pa yongs su smin par byed pa dang / ma zhugs pa 'jug par byed pas so //
translated: he brings to maturity those who have entered, and he causes those who have not entered to enter.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na dang pos ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na dang pos ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bstan to //
translated: In another way, the first verse teaches the accumulation of knowledge.

original: gsum gyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: gsum gyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bstan te /
translated: The next three verses teach the accumulation of merit.

original: nye bar 'dzin pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / 'jug pa rnam pa re res kyang bsod nams kyi khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar 'dzin pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / 'jug pa rnam pa re res kyang bsod nams kyi khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each of the three activities of taking up, bringing to maturity, and causing to enter produces a special merit.

original: yang rgyu gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rgyu gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood by two causes.

original: bsam pas ni byams pa'i sems su'o //
analyzed: bsam pas ni byams pa'i sems su'o //
translated: By intention, he has a loving mind.

original: bsgrub bas ni thob pa dang lung nye bar ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bas ni thob pa dang lung nye bar ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: By practice, he is shown to have attained and to teach the scriptures.

original: chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has four qualities meditates on emptiness.

original: nang du sems su rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mos pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i stobs skyed pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: nang du sems su rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mos pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i stobs skyed pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs par byed pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: and liberation from all obscurations.

original: 'di @109b dag gis ni gang la brten nas ji ltar bsgom pa de yongs su bsten to //
analyzed: 'di @109b dag gis ni gang la brten nas ji ltar bsgom pa de yongs su bsten to //
translated: By these, the cultivation of the perfection of meditation is fully revealed, in terms of what is relied upon and how it is cultivated.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: What is relied upon?

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation.

original: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How is it cultivated?

original: so so'i skye bo'i lam gyis thos pa dang / bsam pa'i stobs skyed pa dang / slob pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i lam gyis thos pa dang / bsam pa'i stobs skyed pa dang / slob pa'i lam dang mi slob pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: By the power of learning and reflection through the path of the ordinary person, and by the path of training and the path of no-more-training.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: When bodhisattvas possess four dharmas,

original: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras ba med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: they have a mind free from hostility towards any sentient being.

original: byams pa bsgom pa dang / sgrub pa rnam par mi 'khrugs pa dang / mtshan ma la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / skyo ba bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa bsgom pa dang / sgrub pa rnam par mi 'khrugs pa dang / mtshan ma la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / skyo ba bzod pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of loving kindness, the non-turbulence of practice, the non-conceptuality of signs, and the forbearance of weariness.

original: 'dir yang gang la brten nas ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang la brten nas ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: Here, it is shown on the basis of what and how one becomes one who has a mind free from hostility.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: On the basis of what?

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i byams pa bsgoms pa las so //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i byams pa bsgoms pa las so //
translated: From the cultivation of loving kindness in previous lives.

original: ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one become one who has a mind free from hostility?

original: log par sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams la sems rnam par mi 'khrugs pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la gnod par byed pa'i mtshan mar rnam par mi rtog pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i don du rtsol ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams la sems rnam par mi 'khrugs pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la gnod par byed pa'i mtshan mar rnam par mi rtog pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i don du rtsol ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'o //
translated: One has a mind that is not disturbed by those who are engaged in wrong practice, one does not conceive of the signs of harmfulness towards those who are harmful, and one is not weary of striving for the benefit of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: A bodhisattva who has four qualities always accomplishes benefit for bodhisattvas.

original: bdag yongs su 'jal ba dang / yang dag pa'i gdams pa la 'jug pa dang / des shing 'grogs na bde ba dang / mchod pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba nye bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yongs su 'jal ba dang / yang dag pa'i gdams pa la 'jug pa dang / des shing 'grogs na bde ba dang / mchod pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba nye bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: 1) He is a person who is completely devoted to the Dharma, 2) he is a person who is completely devoted to the teacher, 3) he is a person who is completely devoted to the meaning, 4) he is a person who is completely devoted to the truth, 5) he is a person who is completely devoted to the teaching, 6) he is a person who is completely devoted to the practice, 7) he is a person who is completely devoted to the self, 8) he is a person who is completely devoted to the right advice, 9) he is a person who is gentle and pleasant to be with, 10) he is a person who is devoted to the service of worship, gain, and honor.

original: 'dir yang gang la brten nas ji ltar nye bar ba sgrub pa de yongs su bsten to //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang la brten nas ji ltar nye bar ba sgrub pa de yongs su bsten to //
translated: Here, he is completely devoted to the one on whom he depends, and in whatever way he is devoted to him.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: On whom does he depend?

original: nga rgyal bcag pa la'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal bcag pa la'o //
translated: On the one who has broken his pride.

original: ji ltar nye bar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bsgrub ce na /
translated: In what way is he devoted?

original: ji skad bstan pa rnam pa gsum gyis dma' ba dang mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa rnam pa gsum gyis dma' ba dang mtshungs pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la go rims bzhin no //
translated: In the three ways already mentioned, to the inferior, the equal, and the superior bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston te /
translated: The bodhisattva who has four qualities expounds the gift of Dharma with a disinterested mind.

original: bar du gcod pa legs par rab tu rtogs pa dang / rmongs pa dang bying ba sel ba la rab tu mkhas pa dang / yid bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / mgon byed pa'i chos las dga' ba'o //🔽'dir yang gang la @110a * //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa legs par rab tu rtogs pa dang / rmongs pa dang bying ba sel ba la rab tu mkhas pa dang / yid bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / mgon byed pa'i chos las dga' ba'o // 'dir yang gang la @110a * //
translated: He is skilled in removing the confusion and laxity of those who are confused and lax, he is skilled in providing satisfaction, and he is skilled in gladdening those who are protected by the Dharma.

original: brten nas ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: brten nas ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: Here, it is shown how he teaches the Dharma correctly, and on what basis he teaches.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: On what basis does he teach?

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti bar du gcod par byed pa nyid du legs par rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti bar du gcod par byed pa nyid du legs par rtogs pa la'o //
translated: He teaches on the basis of understanding that gain and honor are obstacles.

original: ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston ce na /
translated: How does he teach correctly?

original: rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa dang / bag med pa la chags pa dang / bdag dman par 'dzin pas zhum pa rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag bar zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed ba dang /
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams la yang dag par ston pa dang / bag med pa la chags pa dang / bdag dman par 'dzin pas zhum pa rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag bar zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed ba dang /
translated: He teaches correctly to those who are confused, he causes those who are attached to heedlessness and who are discouraged by the thought that the teaching is too difficult to practice to take up the teaching correctly, he extols the teaching, and he delights those who have correctly entered the teaching.

original: rang bzhin gyis chos la dga' bas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis chos la dga' bas so //
translated: because of natural delight in the Dharma.

original: de ltar bzhi pa gzhan ni bzhi pa dang po'i tshig rab tu dbye ba mngon par sgrub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi pa gzhan ni bzhi pa dang po'i tshig rab tu dbye ba mngon par sgrub par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the fourth is to be known as the establishment of the analysis of the terms of the first tetrad.

original: rab tu phye nas kun tu bstan pa rnam par nges pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs par ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: rab tu phye nas kun tu bstan pa rnam par nges pa ni ji skad du bstan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs par ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: The ascertainment of the exposition of the analysis is the understanding of the aggregates, etc., as they have been taught, one by one, etc., as is appropriate.

original: de la gcig nas rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i dri ba ni gang gis chos gcig chos lhag ma gzhan rnams dang lhan cig tu re re nas dris nas de bor te /
analyzed: de la gcig nas rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i dri ba ni gang gis chos gcig chos lhag ma gzhan rnams dang lhan cig tu re re nas dris nas de bor te /
translated: Therein, the question “understanding one by one” is one by whom a single dharma is asked about one by one together with the remaining dharmas, and then that is set aside,

original: des gnyis ba yang gzhan rnams dang / lhan cig tu 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: des gnyis ba yang gzhan rnams dang / lhan cig tu 'dri ba'o //
translated: and then a second is asked about together with the others,

original: de bzhin du re re nas thams cad 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du re re nas thams cad 'dri ba ste /
translated: and so on, one by one, until all are asked about.

original: dper na gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
analyzed: dper na gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
translated: For example, “Whoever possesses the visual medium, does he also possess the visible form medium?

original: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba ni tshig gong ma dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba ni tshig gong ma dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase Whoever possesses the form base also possesses the eye base is connected to the previous phrase.

original: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de rnam ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de rnam ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
translated: The phrase Whoever possesses the eye base also possesses the form base has four possibilities.

original: de bzhin du de yid kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di la mu ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de yid kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di la mu ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase Whoever possesses the eye base also possesses the mental base has four possibilities, and so on up to the phrase Whoever possesses the eye base also possesses the phenomena base, which has four possibilities.

original: de la chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig gong ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //🔽gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa gang yin pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
analyzed: de la chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig gong ma dang sbyar bar bya'o // gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa gang yin pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
translated: The phrase Whoever possesses the phenomena base also possesses the eye base is connected to the previous phrase.🔽The phrase Whoever possesses the form base also possesses the eye base is connected to the previous phrase.

original: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'og ma dang yang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'og ma dang yang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase Whoever possesses the eye base also possesses the form base is connected to the following phrase.

original: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de rna ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di yang tshig 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de rna ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di yang tshig 'og ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The question, “Does one who possesses the visible-form base also possess the ear base?” should be applied to the following lines.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan @110b nam zhes ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan @110b nam zhes ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the question, “Does one who possesses the visible-form base also possess the phenomena base?” should be applied as appropriate.

original: gang rna ba'i skye mched dang ldan pa de ni mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang rna ba'i skye mched dang ldan pa de ni mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
translated: The question, “Does one who possesses the ear base also possess the eye base?” has four possibilities.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the question, “Does one who possesses the ear base also possess the phenomena base?” should be applied as appropriate.

original: de ltar re re nas gsal ba'i tshul gyis skye mched thams cad phan tshun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re re nas gsal ba'i tshul gyis skye mched thams cad phan tshun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, all the bases should be applied to each other in the manner of individual investigation.

original: tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba gnyis gnyis po ni chos 'ga' zhig la brtsams nas phan tshun dris na chos gong ma la brten nas gang lung ston pa ste /
analyzed: tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba gnyis gnyis po ni chos 'ga' zhig la brtsams nas phan tshun dris na chos gong ma la brten nas gang lung ston pa ste /
translated: The two types of application to the preceding line are as follows: When one begins with a certain phenomenon and asks a question about another phenomenon, the answer is based on the preceding phenomenon.

original: dper na shes pa gang yin pa de shes bya yang de'am /
analyzed: dper na shes pa gang yin pa de shes bya yang de'am /
translated: For example, “Is every consciousness also a phenomenon that is known?”

original: shes bya gang yin pa shes pa yang de 'am zhes bya ba'i ni tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: shes bya gang yin pa shes pa yang de 'am zhes bya ba'i ni tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: The phrase “whatever is an object of knowledge is also its consciousness” is connected to the previous phrase.

original: shes pa gang yin pa de shes bya yang de yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa de shes bya yang de yin no //
translated: Whatever is a consciousness is also an object of knowledge.

original: shes bya yin la shes pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: shes bya yin la shes pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There are objects of knowledge that are not consciousnesses,

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: namely, all phenomena other than consciousness.

original: tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ni /🔽de bzhin du gnyis gnyis dris pa la gang phyi ma la brten nas lung ston pa ste /🔽dper na gzung ba gang yin pa de 'dzin pa'ang de 'am /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ni / de bzhin du gnyis gnyis dris pa la gang phyi ma la brten nas lung ston pa ste / dper na gzung ba gang yin pa de 'dzin pa'ang de 'am /
translated: The phrase “whatever is an object of knowledge is also its consciousness” is connected to the following phrase.🔽Similarly, the phrase “whatever is an object of knowledge is also its consciousness” is connected to the following phrase.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa de gzung ba'ang de'am zhes bya ba ni tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa de gzung ba'ang de'am zhes bya ba ni tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: For example, the phrase “whatever is an object of knowledge is also its consciousness” is connected to the following phrase.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba yang de'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba yang de'o //
translated: Whatever is an object of knowledge is also its consciousness.

original: gzung ba yin la 'dzin pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: gzung ba yin la 'dzin pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There are objects of knowledge that are not consciousnesses,

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: namely, the five sense objects such as form and the phenomena base except for those concomitant with consciousness.

original: mu gnyis pa ni gang du mu gnyis ston pa ste /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni gang du mu gnyis ston pa ste /
translated: The second alternative is where two alternatives are taught,

original: de las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing other than those two.

original: dper na phung po rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dper na phung po rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas brjod pa ste /
translated: For example, based on the presentation of the aggregates and the presentation of the elements, it is said:

original: phung po'i grangs gang yin pa khams kyi grangs kyang de'am /
analyzed: phung po'i grangs gang yin pa khams kyi grangs kyang de'am /
translated: Are the number of aggregates the same as the number of elements,🔽or is the number of elements the same as the number of aggregates?

original: khams kyi grangs gang yin pa phung po'i grangs kyang de'am zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: khams kyi grangs gang yin pa phung po'i grangs kyang de'am zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the second alternative.

original: phung po'i grangs yin la khams kyi grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de gzugs kyi phung po dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: phung po'i grangs yin la khams kyi grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de gzugs kyi phung po dang rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: There are aggregates that are not elements, namely, the form aggregate and the consciousness aggregate.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag gam rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag khams gcig tu gyur pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag gam rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag khams gcig tu gyur pa med do //
translated: Thus, the entire definition of the form aggregate or the entire definition of the consciousness aggregate does not become a single element.

original: khams kyi grang yin la phung po'i grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: khams kyi grang yin la phung po'i grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There are elements that are not aggregates.

original: chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams so //
translated: The element of mental objects.

original: mu gsum pa ni gang du mu gsum pa kho na ston pa ste /
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni gang du mu gsum pa kho na ston pa ste /
translated: The third possibility is where only the third possibility is taught.

original: dper @111a * //
analyzed: dper @111a * //
translated: For example,

original: na phung po'i grangs gang yin pa skye mched kyi grangs kyang de 'am /
analyzed: na phung po'i grangs gang yin pa skye mched kyi grangs kyang de 'am /
translated: is the number of aggregates also the number of bases?🔽Or is the number of bases also the number of aggregates?

original: skye mched kyi grangs gang yin pa phung po'i grangs kyang de'am zhes bya ba ni mu gsum pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched kyi grangs gang yin pa phung po'i grangs kyang de'am zhes bya ba ni mu gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third possibility.

original: phung po'i grangs yin la skye mched kyi grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: phung po'i grangs yin la skye mched kyi grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is the number of aggregates that is not the number of bases.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The form aggregate.

original: skye mched ni grangs yin la phung po'i grangs ma yin pa 'ang yod de /
analyzed: skye mched ni grangs yin la phung po'i grangs ma yin pa 'ang yod de /
translated: There is the number of bases that is not the number of aggregates.

original: chos kyi skye mched do /
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched do /
translated: The phenomena base.

original: phung po'i grangs kyang yin la skye mched kyi grangs kyang yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: phung po'i grangs kyang yin la skye mched kyi grangs kyang yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is the number of aggregates that is also the number of bases.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The consciousness aggregate and the mental base.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i grangs ni phung po dang skye mched la med do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'i grangs ni phung po dang skye mched la med do //
translated: The number that is neither is not found in the aggregates or bases.

original: mu bzhi pa ni gang du mu bzhi ston pa ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni gang du mu bzhi ston pa ste /
translated: The fourth possibility is where the four possibilities are taught.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa gang yin pa rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'ang de'am /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa gang yin pa rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'ang de'am /
translated: For example, is one who possesses the eye faculty also one who possesses the ear faculty?🔽Or is one who possesses the ear faculty also one who possesses the eye faculty?

original: rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa gang yin pa mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa'ang de'am zhes bya ba ni mu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa gang yin pa mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa'ang de'am zhes bya ba ni mu bzhi pa ste /
translated: This is a four-part question.

original: mu dang po ni mig skyes shing ma nyams la 'on pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni mig skyes shing ma nyams la 'on pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is one who is born blind but whose eyes have not been damaged.

original: mu gnyis pa ni rna ba skyes shing ma nyams la long ba'o //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni rna ba skyes shing ma nyams la long ba'o //
translated: The second possibility is one who is born deaf but whose eyes have not been damaged.

original: mu gsum pa ni mig dang rna ba skyes la ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni mig dang rna ba skyes la ma nyams pa'o //
translated: The third possibility is one who is born with both eyes and ears undamaged.

original: mu bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth possibility is one who does not possess the eye and ear faculties in any of the above ways.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang dris pa lung du bstan pa la de bzhin no zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang dris pa lung du bstan pa la de bzhin no zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The answer is “It is just so” because the answer to a question is expressed as “It is just so.”

original: de de bzhin no zhes khas len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes khas len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should accept that it is just so.

original: dper na gang mi rtag pa de dag thams cad 'dus byas yin nam /
analyzed: dper na gang mi rtag pa de dag thams cad 'dus byas yin nam /
translated: For example, is everything impermanent compounded?

original: 'dus byas gang yin pa de dag thams cad mi rtag pa'am zhes dris pa la de bzhin no zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas gang yin pa de dag thams cad mi rtag pa'am zhes dris pa la de bzhin no zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: The answer is: Yes, that is so.

original: spang ba ni gang du ma yin no zhes spong ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba ni gang du ma yin no zhes spong ba ste /
translated: The rejection is: Where is it not?

original: dper na phung po lnga las ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams bden pa gang dag gis bsdus zhes zer ba la phung po lnga las ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed dag med do zhes spong ba'o //
analyzed: dper na phung po lnga las ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams bden pa gang dag gis bsdus zhes zer ba la phung po lnga las ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed dag med do zhes spong ba'o //
translated: For example, when asked: Are the volitions included in the truths that are not included in the five aggregates? the answer is: There are no volitions that are not included in the five aggregates.

original: yang dag par dri ba rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: yang dag par dri ba rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The ascertainment of the question is eightfold:

original: ci zhes bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ci zhes bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The teaching of what is the question:

original: su zhig mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: su zhig mi dmigs she na /
translated: Who does not perceive?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci mi dmigs she na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ci mi dmigs she na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: What is not perceived? The characteristics of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: gang gis mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang gis mi dmigs she na /
translated: By whom is it not perceived?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: By the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir @111b mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir @111b mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why is it not perceived?

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to protect all sentient beings and to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: gang las mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang las mi dmigs she na /
translated: From what is there non-apprehension?

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa las so //
translated: From the appearance of the Buddha, from listening to the true Dharma, from proper attention, and from the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gang dag gi mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang dag gi mi dmigs she na /
translated: Of what is there non-apprehension?

original: chos thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Of all dharmas.

original: gang du mi dmigs she na mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa bcu pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang du mi dmigs she na mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas sa bcu pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Where is there non-apprehension? From the stage of action in faith up to the tenth stage.

original: rnam pa du zhig mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: rnam pa du zhig mi dmigs she na /
translated: In how many ways is there non-apprehension?

original: rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: In eleven ways.

original: skyes nas 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / rgyu'i stobs las byung ba dang / mdza' bo'i stobs las byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: skyes nas 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / rgyu'i stobs las byung ba dang / mdza' bo'i stobs las byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang /
translated: the arisen and ceased, the non-arisen, the manifest, that which arises from the power of the cause, that which arises from the power of the friend, the non-apprehension of all dharmas, the non-apprehension of emptiness, that which is associated with the pride of thinking “I am”,

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang / tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa ste /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang / tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs bsags pa ste /
translated: that which is not associated with the pride of thinking “I am”, that which is not accumulated, and that which is accumulated.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di dag ni gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di dag ni gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: These non-apprehensions are whatever they may be,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang phyi dang / rags pa dang phra ba dang / ngan pa dang bzang po dang / rgyang ring ba dang thag nye ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gi go rims kyi tshul gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang phyi dang / rags pa dang phra ba dang / ngan pa dang bzang po dang / rgyang ring ba dang thag nye ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gi go rims kyi tshul gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or subtle, inferior or exalted, distant or near. They should be viewed in this order.

original: ci zhes bstan pa la ji lta bar gang zhes bstan pa la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la gang zhig mi dmigs pa dang / gang dang / gang gis dang / gang gi phyir dang / gang las dang gang gi dang / gang du mi dmigs pa dang /🔽ji snyed cig mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bstan pa la ji lta bar gang zhes bstan pa la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di la gang zhig mi dmigs pa dang / gang dang / gang gis dang / gang gi phyir dang / gang las dang gang gi dang / gang du mi dmigs pa dang / ji snyed cig mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Just as it is with respect to the teaching of what, so it is with respect to the teaching of what kind, what, by what, for what reason, from what, of what, where, and how much is not apprehended.

original: yang rnam par nges pa'i lam bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par nges pa'i lam bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of ascertainment:

original: sun 'byin par byed pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la sun 'byin par byed pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs nyes par smras pa la /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa la sogs pa'o // de la sun 'byin par byed pa ni gzhan gyi phyogs nyes par smras pa la /
translated: refutation, proof, cutting off, and explanation.

original: 'di legs pa ma yin no zhes sel par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di legs pa ma yin no zhes sel par byed pa'o //
translated: Refutation is the removal of what others have wrongly said about their own position, saying, “This is not good.”

original: sgrub par byed pa ni rang gi phyogs legs par smras pa la 'di ni legs pa'o zhes 'jog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni rang gi phyogs legs par smras pa la 'di ni legs pa'o zhes 'jog par byed pa'o //
translated: Proof is the establishment of what is good about one’s own position, saying, “This is good.”

original: gcod par byed pa ni gzhan dag gi the tshom skyed pa'am /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa ni gzhan dag gi the tshom skyed pa'am /
translated: Cutting off is the removal of the doubts of others, whether they have arisen or not.

original: ma skyes pa la rnam par nges par sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la rnam par nges par sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: Explanation is the teaching of the meaning of the text of the treatise by means of the four types of statements.

original: khong du chud par byed pa ni don de @112a * //
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pa ni don de @112a * //
translated: Understanding is the meaning of that.🔽🔽

original: dang de dag la rmongs pa rnams la don de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang de dag la rmongs pa rnams la don de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The determination of comprehension is the teaching of that meaning to those who are confused about this and that meaning.

original: bya ba sgrub pa rnam par nges pa ni 'jig rten phan tshun du 'tsho ba'i thabs la sogs pa'i dgos pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa rnam par nges pa ni 'jig rten phan tshun du 'tsho ba'i thabs la sogs pa'i dgos pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: The determination of the accomplishment of action is the accomplishment of the purpose of mutual livelihood in the world and so forth.

original: 'jug pa rnam par nges pa ni theg pa gsum po dag las theg pa gang la 'jug par bya zhing zhugs par bya zhes rnam par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnam par nges pa ni theg pa gsum po dag las theg pa gang la 'jug par bya zhing zhugs par bya zhes rnam par spyod pa'o //
translated: The determination of engagement is the analysis of which vehicle one should enter and engage from among the three vehicles.

original: mos par rnam par rnam par nges pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ji ltar thos pa bzhin du yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: mos par rnam par rnam par nges pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ji ltar thos pa bzhin du yid ches pa'o //
translated: The determination of conviction is the conviction in accordance with what one has heard through the wisdom arisen from hearing.

original: rigs pas rnam par nges pa ni bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis snga phyi'i dgongs pa yongs su 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pas rnam par nges pa ni bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis snga phyi'i dgongs pa yongs su 'jal ba'o //
translated: The determination of reasoning is the evaluation of the earlier and later intentions through the wisdom arisen from contemplation.

original: 'bel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par nges pa ni ji ltar thos pa dang bsam pa rnams dri ba dang phyir zhing dri bar bya ba'i tshul gyis phan tshun chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'bel pa'i gtam gyis rnam par nges pa ni ji ltar thos pa dang bsam pa rnams dri ba dang phyir zhing dri bar bya ba'i tshul gyis phan tshun chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Ascertainment by means of abundant speech is the mutual enjoyment of the Dharma by means of questions and repeated questions, in the manner of How is it to be heard? and How is it to be reflected upon?

original: rab tu rtogs pas rnam par nges pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pas rnam par nges pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: Ascertainment by means of full understanding is the path of seeing,

original: des bden pa rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bden pa rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one fully understands the truths.

original: rnam par dag pas rnam par nges pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas rnam par nges pa ni bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: Ascertainment by means of purification is the path of cultivation,

original: nges nyon mong pa ma lus par rnam par spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges nyon mong pa ma lus par rnam par spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one completely abandons the defilements without remainder.

original: mngon par bsgrub pas rnam par nges pa ni khyad par can gyi lam ste /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pas rnam par nges pa ni khyad par can gyi lam ste /
translated: Ascertainment by means of accomplishment is the special path,

original: des yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by it one accomplishes the special qualities.

original: tshig rab tu dbye ba rnam par nges pa ni gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas chos ston pa la mtha' yas so //
analyzed: tshig rab tu dbye ba rnam par nges pa ni gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang bzhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo nas chos ston pa la mtha' yas so //
translated: Ascertainment by means of the differentiation of words is the teaching of the Dharma by means of the accomplishment of the second, third, fourth, etc. aspects, and so on, without limit.

original: lhun gyis grub pa dang rtsol ba tsam gyi don thams cad 'grub pa rnam par nges pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa dang rtsol ba tsam gyi don thams cad 'grub pa rnam par nges pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The knowledge of the Tathagata is the ascertainment of all that is to be done by spontaneous and deliberate action.

original: sngon gyi rtsol ba med par yang don thams cad la rtsol ba'i mdo las chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mthong ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi rtsol ba med par yang don thams cad la rtsol ba'i mdo las chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi mthong ba 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sutra of the Absence of Volition says that the knowledge of the Tathagata is the vision of all that is to be done without prior volition, and the vision of the unobstructed and unimpeded knowledge.

original: smra ba rnam par nges pa ni smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal ce ba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba rnam par nges pa ni smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal ce ba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of speech is the skill in speech, in the speaker, in the audience, and so on.

original: de la smra ba ni tshig thams cad do //
analyzed: de la smra ba ni tshig thams cad do //
translated: Speech is all words.

original: rmad khyer bar smra ba ni 'jig rten na rnam par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rmad khyer bar smra ba ni 'jig rten na rnam par smra ba'o //
translated: The world speaks in a variety of ways.

original: rtsod par smra ba ni mi mthun par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod par smra ba ni mi mthun par smra ba'o //
translated: It speaks in opposition, in debate.

original: tshig ngan par smra ba ni smad par smra ba'o //🔽mthun par smra ba ni rjes su mthun par smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig ngan par smra ba ni smad par smra ba'o // mthun par smra ba ni rjes su mthun par smra ba'o //
translated: It speaks in contempt, in abuse.🔽It speaks in agreement, in approval.

original: gdams par smra ba ni khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir smra ba'o //
analyzed: gdams par smra ba ni khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir smra ba'o //
translated: It speaks in instruction, in order to make others understand.

original: smra ba'i zhal ce ba ni gang du smra bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i zhal ce ba ni gang du smra bar bya ba ste /
translated: The place of debate is where the debate is held.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rgyal po'i @112b pho brang ni gang na rgyal po nyid bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i @112b pho brang ni gang na rgyal po nyid bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The king's palace is where the king himself resides.

original: bskos pa 'du ba'i sa ni gang du rgyal pos bskos pa rnams 'du ba'o //
analyzed: bskos pa 'du ba'i sa ni gang du rgyal pos bskos pa rnams 'du ba'o //
translated: The place where the appointed gather is where the king's appointees gather.

original: 'dus pa ni tshong ba la 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni tshong ba la 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: An assembly is a gathering of merchants, etc.

original: tshad mar rung ba'i zla grogs ni gang dag gi tshig smra ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mar rung ba'i zla grogs ni gang dag gi tshig smra ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas mi gcod pa'o //
translated: A group of reliable witnesses is those whose words are not rejected by either the proponent or the opponent.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze chos dang don la mkhas pa rnams ni gang dag bstan bcos de dang de dag gi tshig dang don la blo byang ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze chos dang don la mkhas pa rnams ni gang dag bstan bcos de dang de dag gi tshig dang don la blo byang ba'o //
translated: The virtuous and the brahmins who are learned in the Dharma and its meaning are those whose minds are trained in the words and meanings of the various treatises.

original: smra ba'i gzhi ni gang la brten nas smra bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i gzhi ni gang la brten nas smra bar bya ba ste /
translated: The basis of debate is that upon which the debate is based.

original: 'di lta ste sgrub pa dang grub pa'o //🔽de la ngo bo nyid sgrub pa ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid de yod de zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sgrub pa dang grub pa'o // de la ngo bo nyid sgrub pa ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid de yod de zhe'am /
translated: It is like this: proof and establishment.

original: med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therein, the proof of essence is the essence of the self and the essence of phenomena, whether they exist or not.

original: khyad par sgrub pa ni bdag gi khyad par dang chos kyi khyad par te /🔽thams cad du song ba'am /
analyzed: khyad par sgrub pa ni bdag gi khyad par dang chos kyi khyad par te / thams cad du song ba'am /
translated: the thesis that is not common to all and the thesis that is common to all.🔽The thesis that is not common to all is of four kinds:🔽the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by anyone,🔽the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by the opponent,🔽the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by the proponent,🔽and the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by either.🔽The specific dharma is of four kinds:🔽the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by anyone,

original: thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'am /
translated: the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by the opponent,🔽the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by the proponent,🔽and the thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by either.🔽The thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by anyone is like saying,🔽The self is permanent, unitary, and partless.🔽The thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by the opponent is like saying,

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i gzugs can nam gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa su'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa'i gzugs can nam gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa su'o //
translated: The self is impermanent, manifold, and partless.

original: dam bca' ba ni bdag 'dod pa sgrub pa'i don gzhan la go bar ston pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni bdag 'dod pa sgrub pa'i don gzhan la go bar ston pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by the proponent is like saying,🔽The self is permanent, unitary, and partless.🔽The thesis that is not common to all because it is not accepted by either is like saying,

original: gal te sgrub pa ma smos na bdag gi phyogs grub zin pa yang gzhan dag la bstan par dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa ma smos na bdag gi phyogs grub zin pa yang gzhan dag la bstan par dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The self is permanent, unitary, and partless.🔽The thesis that is common to all is of two kinds:🔽the thesis that is common to all because it is accepted by all,🔽and the thesis that is common to all because it is accepted by the opponent.

original: bdag 'dod pa'i don ma smos na ni gzhan gyi phyogs bsgrub pa'i tshig kyang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa'i don ma smos na ni gzhan gyi phyogs bsgrub pa'i tshig kyang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The thesis that is common to all because it is accepted by all is like saying,🔽The self is permanent, unitary, and partless.🔽The thesis that is common to all because it is accepted by the opponent is like saying,🔽The self is impermanent, manifold, and partless.🔽The thesis that is common to all because it is accepted by the proponent is like saying,

original: gzhan ma smos na ni gcig pu yang tshig de dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te go bar ma smos na ni lus kyi don de brda spyod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma smos na ni gcig pu yang tshig de dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //🔽gal te go bar ma smos na ni lus kyi don de brda spyod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The self is permanent, unitary, and partless.

original: gal te ston pa ma smos na ni nyan pa rnams kyis don de ma shes na yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ston pa ma smos na ni nyan pa rnams kyis don de ma shes na yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the teacher is not mentioned, then even if the listeners do not understand the meaning, it is a thesis.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa la nyes pa 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa la nyes pa 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur te /
translated: All these faults are absent in the establishment as it is taught.

original: de lta bas na 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood as established in that way.

original: gtan tshigs ni sgrub pa nyid la ma grags pa'i don yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs par bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni sgrub pa nyid la ma grags pa'i don yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs par bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reason is the cause of conviction in the meaning that is not well known in the proof, which is called the perception of what is directly observed and the non-observation of what is not directly observed.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu'i don 'dir gtan tshigs kyi don zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu'i don 'dir gtan tshigs kyi don zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: Here, the meaning of the cause of conviction is shown to be the meaning of reason.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa zhes bstan pa 'dis sgrub pa de nyid la ma grags pa'i don la yid ches pa skye ba ste /🔽des na de bsnyad pa'i rgyur @113a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa zhes bstan pa 'dis sgrub pa de nyid la ma grags pa'i don la yid ches pa skye ba ste / des na de bsnyad pa'i rgyur @113a * //
translated: Thus, by teaching the perception of what is directly observed and the non-observation of what is not directly observed, conviction arises in the meaning that is not well known in that proof.

original: gyur pa'i phyir gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa'i phyir gtan tshigs zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because it becomes the cause of expressing that, it is called a reason.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi tshul dang rtags kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa dang ma dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi tshul dang rtags kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The direct perception of the object and the non-perception of the object should be understood as being in terms of the mode of the nature of things and in terms of the evidence.

original: dpe ni mtha' mthong ba dang / mtha' ma mthong ba mtshungs par sbyar zhing bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni grags pa'i cha dang ma grags pa'i cha rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe ni mtha' mthong ba dang / mtha' ma mthong ba mtshungs par sbyar zhing bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni grags pa'i cha dang ma grags pa'i cha rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The example is the application and the explanation of the seen end and the unseen end. This is because it is for the purpose of understanding the known part and the unknown part.

original: bsnyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i rigs kyi chos lhag ma de dang 'dra ba la de'i chos sbyar ba'i phyir tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsgrub pa'i don yan lag gsum gyis bsgrubs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bsnyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // nye bar sbyor ba ni de'i rigs kyi chos lhag ma de dang 'dra ba la de'i chos sbyar ba'i phyir tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsgrub pa'i don yan lag gsum gyis bsgrubs pa de bzhin du /
translated: The meaning of “explanation” is the same as “application.”🔽The application is the explanation of the method by applying the property to the remainder of that type, because it is similar to that. This is because just as the meaning of the proof is established by the three parts,

original: lhag ma de dang 'dra ba sgrub pa grub pa rnams la yang sgrub pa'i don gyis chos sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma de dang 'dra ba sgrub pa grub pa rnams la yang sgrub pa'i don gyis chos sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, the meaning of the proof is applied to the properties of the remainder that are to be established, because it is similar to that.

original: tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad cing rigs pa 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
