analyzed: tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad cing rigs pa 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The application is the statement of the reason, which is similar to the proof.

original: mjug sdud pas ni mthar phyin par bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar rigs pas legs par 'thad pa de'i phyir de ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni mjug sdud du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud pas ni mthar phyin par bsnyad pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar rigs pas legs par 'thad pa de'i phyir de ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba de ni mjug sdud du rig par bya'o //
translated: The conclusion is the statement of the final position.

original: dam bca' ba la sogs pa 'di dag gi dper brjod pa tsam 'di rab tu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba la sogs pa 'di dag gi dper brjod pa tsam 'di rab tu bstan par bya ste /
translated: The example of these theses, etc. should be taught.

original: dper na rtsod pa'i phyir rgol ba dang bcas pa de la bdag med par smra bas bdag med do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsod pa'i phyir rgol ba dang bcas pa de la bdag med par smra bas bdag med do zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dam bca' ba'o //
translated: For example, in a debate, the statement of the proponent of selflessness, “There is no self,” is the thesis.

original: phung po la bdag tu 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshig te /
analyzed: phung po la bdag tu 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshig te /
translated: The reason is, “Because four errors are seen in the designation of the self in the aggregates.”

original: bdag de la 'dogs na phung po'i mtshan nyid du'am /
analyzed: bdag de la 'dogs na phung po'i mtshan nyid du'am /
translated: If one designates that self, it is designated as the characteristic of the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams la'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams la'am /
translated: or in the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams las gzhan pa'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan pa'am /
translated: or other than the aggregates,🔽or as the appropriator of the aggregates.

original: phung po med pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
analyzed: phung po med pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
translated: If it is designated as not being a collection,

original: de gal te phung po'i mtshan nyid ces byar ni phung po de dag rang dbang med par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: de gal te phung po'i mtshan nyid ces byar ni phung po de dag rang dbang med par rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can te /
translated: if it is said to have the characteristics of a collection, then those collections are not independent, but are dependently arisen and subject to destruction.

original: bdag de'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pas nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag de'i mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pas nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not tenable that the self has the characteristics of those, there is a fault.

original: ji ste phung po rnams la 'dogs na ni nges na phung po mi rtag pa la brten pas bdag mi rtag par 'gyur pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste phung po rnams la 'dogs na ni nges na phung po mi rtag pa la brten pas bdag mi rtag par 'gyur pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated in dependence on the aggregates, then since the self would be dependent on impermanent aggregates, it would follow that the self is impermanent.

original: ji ste phung po dag las gzhan du 'dogs na ni des na bdag lus med cing sgrim ma mi dgos pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste phung po dag las gzhan du 'dogs na ni des na bdag lus med cing sgrim ma mi dgos pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated as other than the aggregates, then since the self would be without a body and without exertion, there would be a fault.

original: gal te phung po med par 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po med par 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is designated as not being a collection,

original: rang bzhin gyis grol ba ma 'dres @113b pa yin pas thar par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grol ba ma 'dres @113b pa yin pas thar par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: since it would be naturally liberated and unmixed, there would be the fault that striving for liberation would be pointless.

original: da ltar la 'das pa 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: da ltar la 'das pa 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The example is like designating the present as past.

original: 'das pa de yod pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar 'dogs pa na de ltar gyi mtshan nyid du'am /
analyzed: 'das pa de yod pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar 'dogs pa na de ltar gyi mtshan nyid du'am /
translated: If the past is designated as having only the characteristic of existence, then it would be designated as having that characteristic

original: da ltar byung ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'am /
translated: in the present,

original: de ltar byung ngam sa gzhan du'am /
analyzed: de ltar byung ngam sa gzhan du'am /
translated: or in the past, or in another place,

original: da ltar byung ba la mi ltos pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la mi ltos pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
translated: or without depending on the present.

original: de gal te da ltar gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs na ni des na da ltar ni byung la ma 'gags pa yin pas de'i mtshan nyid 'das pa yang byung la ma 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gal te da ltar gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs na ni des na da ltar ni byung la ma 'gags pa yin pas de'i mtshan nyid 'das pa yang byung la ma 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated as having the characteristic of the present, then since the present has arisen and not yet ceased, the error would arise that its characteristic, the past, has arisen and not yet ceased.

original: ji ste da ltar la 'dogs na des na ma 'gags pa ni 'gags pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel bar mi rung bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste da ltar la 'dogs na des na ma 'gags pa ni 'gags pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel bar mi rung bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated as the present, then since that which has not yet ceased is not suitable to be related to the nature of that which has ceased, there would be an error.

original: ji ste da ltar las gzhan du 'dogs na ni des na da ltar bor na dngos po de ci yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: ji ste da ltar las gzhan du 'dogs na ni des na da ltar bor na dngos po de ci yang mi dmigs te /
translated: If it is designated as other than the present, then since it is discarded in the present, that thing is not observed at all.

original: de la de 'dogs pa nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de 'dogs pa nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The error would arise that it is designated in that.

original: ji ste da ltar la mi ltos na ni des na 'dus ma byas kyang 'das par 'gyur bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste da ltar la mi ltos na ni des na 'dus ma byas kyang 'das par 'gyur bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not depend on the present, then the unconditioned would also be past, and that would be a fault.

original: 'das pa de ni mtshan nyid nyams pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis med par grub bo //
analyzed: 'das pa de ni mtshan nyid nyams pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis med par grub bo //
translated: That past is established as nonexistent by its characteristics, because its characteristics have deteriorated.

original: de'i phyir da ltar la 'dogs pa la nyes pa bzhi grub pa 'dis /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar la 'dogs pa la nyes pa bzhi grub pa 'dis /
translated: Therefore, this establishment of four faults in the designation of the present

original: bdag med pa ma grub pa yang phung po la 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'i phyir med par rab tu grub bo //
analyzed: bdag med pa ma grub pa yang phung po la 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'i phyir med par rab tu grub bo //
translated: establishes the nonexistence of the self that is designated in the aggregates, because four faults are observed in the designation of the aggregates.

original: de ltar bdag tu phyin ci log pa bkag nas rig pa 'dis rtag pa la sogs pa yang med do zhes 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu phyin ci log pa bkag nas rig pa 'dis rtag pa la sogs pa yang med do zhes 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyar ro //
translated: Having thus refuted the error of self, this knowledge is applied to show the similarity of permanence, etc., as nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar yin pa de'i phyir phung po lnga ni mi rtag pa nas bdag gi ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar yin pa de'i phyir phung po lnga ni mi rtag pa nas bdag gi ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud do //
translated: The conclusion is: Therefore, the five aggregates are impermanent up to not the self of mine.

original: mngon sum ni rang gi don yod cing snang la ma nor ba'o zhes bya ba de la rang gi don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang gi don yod cing snang la ma nor ba'o zhes bya ba de la rang gi don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The existent object is as follows:

original: mig gi gzugs so //🔽yod pa smos pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas 'jig rten na mngon sum du grags pa rnams mngon sum ma yin pa gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mig gi gzugs so // yod pa smos pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas 'jig rten na mngon sum du grags pa rnams mngon sum ma yin pa gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The eye and form.

original: brtags pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: The mention of existent is for the purpose of clarifying that such things as a pot, which are renowned in the world as being perceived, are not perception, because they are mere imputations.

original: snang ba smos pa ni bsgrib pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i yul bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba smos pa ni bsgrib pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i yul bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of appearance is for the purpose of excluding objects that do not appear due to causes such as obstruction.

original: ma nor ba smos pa ni mgal me bskor ba dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nor ba smos pa ni mgal me bskor ba dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu la sogs pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of nonerroneous is for the purpose of excluding such things as a firebrand wheel and illusions and mirages.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi lhag ma la yid ches pa'o @114a * //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi lhag ma la yid ches pa'o @114a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Inference is the conviction about the remainder of perception.

original: mngon sum las gzhan pa gang yin pa ni lhag mthong mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan pa gang yin pa ni lhag mthong mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is other than perception is the remainder of perception.

original: nges par de dang lhan cig gnas par mthong ba la sngar rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: nges par de dang lhan cig gnas par mthong ba la sngar rab tu grub pa'o //
translated: The prior establishment of the perception of the invariable concomitance is the first step.🔽The second step is the perception of the object to be inferred along with the reason.🔽The third step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.🔽The fourth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.🔽The fifth step is the inference.

original: mngon sum de la de lta bas na de las gzhan la lhag ma la 'dir ni 'di de dang lhan cig gnas pa yin no zhes yid ches par 'gyur ba de mngon sum sngon du song ba'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum de la de lta bas na de las gzhan la lhag ma la 'dir ni 'di de dang lhan cig gnas pa yin no zhes yid ches par 'gyur ba de mngon sum sngon du song ba'i rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: The sixth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The seventh step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.

original: dper na du ba mthong ba la me lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na du ba mthong ba la me lta bu'o //
translated: The eighth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.🔽The ninth step is the inference.🔽The tenth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The eleventh step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.🔽The twelfth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.

original: yid ches pa'i lung ni de gnyi ga dang mi 'gal bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung ni de gnyi ga dang mi 'gal bar ston pa ste /
translated: The thirteenth step is the inference.🔽The fourteenth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The fifteenth step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.🔽The sixteenth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.

original: nye bar bstan pa gang la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de rnam pa thams cad du 'gal ba med cing 'khrul pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa gang la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa de rnam pa thams cad du 'gal ba med cing 'khrul pa med pa ste /
translated: The seventeenth step is the inference.🔽The eighteenth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The nineteenth step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.

original: yid ches pa'i lung ni yid ches par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung ni yid ches par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The twentieth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.🔽The twenty-first step is the inference.🔽The twenty-second step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The twenty-third step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.

original: smra ba'i rgyan ni gang dang ldan na smra ba smra bar byed pa'i tshe shin tu mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i rgyan ni gang dang ldan na smra ba smra bar byed pa'i tshe shin tu mdzes pa'o //
translated: The twenty-fourth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.🔽The twenty-fifth step is the inference.🔽The twenty-sixth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The twenty-seventh step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.🔽The twenty-eighth step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.🔽The twenty-ninth step is the inference.

original: de yang bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs shes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs shes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The thirtieth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The thirty-first step is the recollection of the invariable concomitance.🔽The thirty-second step is the ascertainment of the presence of the reason in the subject.🔽The thirty-third step is the inference.🔽The thirty-fourth step is the perception of the object inferred along with the reason.🔽The thirty-fifth step is the recollection of the

original: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs shes pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs shes pa ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' las brtsams te /
translated: Knowing one's own and others' systems is to begin with one's own tenets and those of others.

original: tshig dang don snga phyi rgyun chags par rnam par ston par lcogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang don snga phyi rgyun chags par rnam par ston par lcogs pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of one's own and others' doctrines is the ability to expound the scriptures of one's own and others' schools in a continuous sequence of words and meanings.

original: tshig zur phyin pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sgra smra ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtam gyis nyes pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: tshig zur phyin pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sgra smra ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtam gyis nyes pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the expression is the avoidance of the faults of speech mentioned below.

original: cal col la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cal col la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the absence of babbling, etc.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni du ma btsun pa dang mngon bar zhen pa can mkhas pa dag 'dus par smra zhing /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni du ma btsun pa dang mngon bar zhen pa can mkhas pa dag 'dus par smra zhing /
translated: The fearlessness is the absence of timidity in the assembly of the learned who are pure and full of conviction.

original: bag tsha ba med pa la 'dzem pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bag tsha ba med pa la 'dzem pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of embarrassment is the absence of shame in the face of the learned.

original: brtan pa ni phyir rgol ba'i tshig mjug tu phyin par bsdad nas yid dal du smra ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni phyir rgol ba'i tshig mjug tu phyin par bsdad nas yid dal du smra ba'o //
translated: The steadiness is the ability to speak slowly and with a calm mind, having sat down after the opponent has finished speaking.

original: mthun par byed pa ni rang bzhin gyis bzang bas gzu bo dang phyir rgol ba'i sems dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par byed pa ni rang bzhin gyis bzang bas gzu bo dang phyir rgol ba'i sems dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The harmony is the ability to speak in a way that is agreeable to the opponent's mind, because one is naturally good-natured and honest.

original: smra ba chad pas bcad pa ni gang gis smra ba chad pas bcad ces bya ba ste /🔽de yang gtam rjes bcad pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la gtam rjes bcad pa la ni bdag gi ni ma legs so //
analyzed: smra ba chad pas bcad pa ni gang gis smra ba chad pas bcad ces bya ba ste / de yang gtam rjes bcad pa la sogs pa'o // de la gtam rjes bcad pa la ni bdag gi ni ma legs so //
translated: The suppression of speech is that by which speech is suppressed.

original: khyod kyi ni legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi smra ba'i skyon dang yon tan khas blang ba'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ni legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi smra ba'i skyon dang yon tan khas blang ba'o //
translated: That is, by the aspects I am not good, You are good, and so on, one admits the faults and virtues of one's own and others' speech.

original: gtam 'phro lus pa ni gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa la sogs pas bskal ba'o //
analyzed: gtam 'phro lus pa ni gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa la sogs pas bskal ba'o //
translated: The unfinished conversation is the interruption of a conversation by changing the subject, and so on.

original: gtam gyi nyes pa ni cal col la sogs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gtam gyi nyes pa ni cal col la sogs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The fault of conversation is the words chatter and so on.

original: de la cal col @114b ni gang skabs bor te /
analyzed: de la cal col @114b ni gang skabs bor te /
translated: Therein, chatter is that which, having missed the occasion,

original: gtam sna tshogs rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: expatiates on various topics.

original: 'khrugs pa ni gang khros pas g-yeng ba dang / dga' bas g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni gang khros pas g-yeng ba dang / dga' bas g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Disorder is that which is distracted by anger or distracted by joy.

original: brda phrad du mi rung ba ni gang chos dang don 'khor dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: brda phrad du mi rung ba ni gang chos dang don 'khor dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis ma zin pa'o //
translated: The unintelligible is that which is not grasped by the assembly or the adversary because of its Dharma and meaning.

original: ran pa ma yin pa ni gang tshig lhag ma dang zlos pa dang nyungs pa'o //
analyzed: ran pa ma yin pa ni gang tshig lhag ma dang zlos pa dang nyungs pa'o //
translated: Inappropriate is that which is redundant, repetitive, or too brief.

original: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni de rnam pa lngar ba lta bar bya ste /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni de rnam pa lngar ba lta bar bya ste /
translated: Meaningless is of five types:

original: don med pa dang / don dang bral ba dang / rigs pa dang bral ba dang / sgrub par mtshungs pa dang ltag chod dang ldan pa ste /🔽don mi dmigs pa'i phyir ri //
analyzed: don med pa dang / don dang bral ba dang / rigs pa dang bral ba dang / sgrub par mtshungs pa dang ltag chod dang ldan pa ste / don mi dmigs pa'i phyir ri //
translated: meaningless, irrelevant, illogical, repetitive, and contradictory.

original: don dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Meaningless is that which is not understood because the meaning is not perceived.🔽Irrelevant is that which is not connected with the meaning.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Illogical is that which is not established because of uncertainty.

original: grub pa yang bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub pa yang bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Repetitive is that which is established but must be established again.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshogs par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / smra ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshogs par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / smra ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Contradictory is that which is not in accordance with reality, is not a natural occurrence, and is not in accordance with all statements.

original: dus tshigs ma yin par smra ba ni gang sngar smra bar bya ba de phyis smra ba dang / phyis smra bar bya ba de sngar smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs ma yin par smra ba ni gang sngar smra bar bya ba de phyis smra ba dang / phyis smra bar bya ba de sngar smra bar bya'o //
translated: Inappropriate timing is that which is spoken at the wrong time, such as speaking later what should be said earlier, or speaking earlier what should be said later.

original: mi rtag pa ni gang dam bcas nas smod pa dang / smad nas yang dam 'cha' ba dang / myur ches pas ha cang rtab rtab por gyur te mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni gang dam bcas nas smod pa dang / smad nas yang dam 'cha' ba dang / myur ches pas ha cang rtab rtab por gyur te mi gsal ba'o //
translated: Impermanence is that which, having been promised, is then criticized; having been criticized, it is then promised again; and it is too quick, too hurried, and not clear.🔽Unclear speech is that which is contrary to the characteristics of speech, that which is spoken without taking up the correct pronunciation, and that which is spoken with a vernacular at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end, or with a classical language at the beginning and in the middle, but with a vernacular at the end.🔽Unconnected speech is that which is interrupted by other words and other topics.

original: tshig mi gsal ba ni gang sgra'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba dang / phyir ma bzlas par len smras pa dang / legs par sbyar ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: tshig mi gsal ba ni gang sgra'i mtshan nyid dang 'gal ba dang / phyir ma bzlas par len smras pa dang / legs par sbyar ba las brtsams te /
translated: Uninterrupted speech is that which is not interrupted by other words and other topics.🔽Speech that is not spontaneous is that which is not spoken from the mind.🔽Speech that is spontaneous is that which is spoken from the mind.🔽Speech that is not well-prepared is that which is spoken without having examined the faults and virtues of speech.

original: tha mal bas mthar phyung ba dang / tha mal pa las brtsams te legs par sbyar bas mthar phyung ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal bas mthar phyung ba dang / tha mal pa las brtsams te legs par sbyar bas mthar phyung ba'o //
translated: Speech that is well-prepared is that which is spoken after having examined the faults and virtues of speech.🔽Speech that is not fluent is that which is interrupted by hesitations, by the forgetting of words and topics.🔽Speech that is fluent is that which is not interrupted by hesitations, by the forgetting of words and topics.🔽Speech that is not clear is that which is not clear because of a defect in pronunciation, or because of a defect in the organ of hearing.🔽Speech that is clear is that which is clear because of the absence of defects in pronunciation and in the organ of hearing.

original: tshig rgyun chags pa ma yin pa ni /🔽gang bar skabs su tshig dang spobs pa thogs pa dang rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: tshig rgyun chags pa ma yin pa ni / gang bar skabs su tshig dang spobs pa thogs pa dang rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Speech that is not distinct is that which is not distinct because of the indistinct pronunciation of the phonemes.

original: smra ba las byung ba ni gang gis smras pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: smra ba las byung ba ni gang gis smras pa las byung ba ste /
translated: Speech that is distinct is that which is distinct because of the distinct pronunciation of the phonemes.🔽Speech that is not reasonable is that which is contrary to the three knowledges.🔽Speech that is reasonable is that which is not contrary to the three knowledges.🔽Speech that is not well-founded is that which is not based on the three knowledges.🔽Speech that is well-founded is that which is based on the three knowledges.🔽Speech that is not pleasing is that which is not pleasing to the person to whom it is spoken.🔽Speech that is pleasing is that which is pleasing to the person to whom it is spoken.

original: smra ba'i yon tan dang nyes pa brtags nas mi byed pas 'byung ba ni chad pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smra ba'i yon tan dang nyes pa brtags nas mi byed pas 'byung ba ni chad pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech that is not acceptable is that which is not accepted by the person to whom it is spoken.

original: byed pas 'byung ba ni lcogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pas 'byung ba ni lcogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech that is acceptable is that which is accepted by the person to whom it is spoken.🔽Speech that

original: de la phyir rgol ba snod ma yin pa ni mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste /
analyzed: de la phyir rgol ba snod ma yin pa ni mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslang ste /
translated: Those who are adversaries who are not suitable vessels are those who are to be lifted from nonvirtue.

original: dge ba'i gnas su gzhag par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su gzhag par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The opponent who is not a proper vessel is one who cannot be lifted up from a nonvirtuous state and placed in a virtuous state.

original: 'khor yon tan med pa ni tshogs pa rung ba ma yin pa dang / mngon par zhen pa can dang / phyogs su lhung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor yon tan med pa ni tshogs pa rung ba ma yin pa dang / mngon par zhen pa can dang / phyogs su lhung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: An assembly that lacks good qualities is one that is not suitable for a gathering, one that is full of attachment, one that is biased, and so on.

original: bdag kyang mi mkhas pa ni smra ba nas smra ba'i rgyan gyi bar la ma byang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang mi mkhas pa ni smra ba nas smra ba'i rgyan gyi bar la ma byang ba'o //
translated: One's own lack of skill is unfamiliarity with speaking and the ornaments of speech.

original: de las bzlog pa ni 'khor snod du gyur pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //🔽smra ba la gces spras @115a * //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni 'khor snod du gyur pa la sogs par rig par bya'o // smra ba la gces spras @115a * //
translated: The opposite of these should be understood as the proper vessel for an assembly and so on.

original: byed pa'i chos rnams ni gang dag smra ba rnams la gdon mi za bar dgos pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i chos rnams ni gang dag smra ba rnams la gdon mi za bar dgos pa ste /
translated: The qualities that are cherished in speech are those that are certainly necessary for speakers.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la mkhas pa ni smra ba la gces spras byed pa'i chos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la mkhas pa ni smra ba la gces spras byed pa'i chos te /
translated: Thus, being learned in the systems of others is a quality cherished in speech.

original: des gtam gyi gzhi thams cad du smra bar byed do //
analyzed: des gtam gyi gzhi thams cad du smra bar byed do //
translated: By that, one speaks in all contexts of conversation.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla bsam bshad do //
translated: The rest are easy to understand, so I will not comment on them.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa zhes bya ba gsungs nas nan tan snying por byed pa zhes bka' stsal pa ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa zhes bya ba gsungs nas nan tan snying por byed pa zhes bka' stsal pa ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase striving in virtue is stated, and the phrase making effort the essence is stated in order to show the purity of attitude.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i rgyur thos pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa'i rgyur thos pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not striving in virtue such as listening for the sake of gain, honor, etc.

original: sems can bsdus pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sems can bsdus pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase gathering sentient beings is stated in order to distinguish from the śrāvakas, etc.

original: gzhan la phan par sgrub pa lhur len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan la phan par sgrub pa lhur len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means devoted to accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: de ltar bdag la phan ba dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'di dag gi mtshams sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag la phan ba dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'di dag gi mtshams sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the phrase quickly fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment should be understood as connected with the words striving for one's own welfare and striving for the welfare of others.

original: mi rtsod par smra bar byed du zin kyang theg pa chen po'i chos ni rang bzhin gyis zab pa'i phyir kun shes pa dkon na rtsod pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: mi rtsod par smra bar byed du zin kyang theg pa chen po'i chos ni rang bzhin gyis zab pa'i phyir kun shes pa dkon na rtsod pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: Even if one were to speak without dispute, since the Dharma of the Great Vehicle is profound by nature, it is rare to find someone who understands it. What need is there to mention dispute?

original: gang dag dang lhan cig tu rtsod pas smra bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag dang lhan cig tu rtsod pas smra bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Those with whom one would speak in dispute

original: smra ba de dag kun shes par bya ba'i bsam pas phyir smra ba ma yin gyi skyon gdags pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: smra ba de dag kun shes par bya ba'i bsam pas phyir smra ba ma yin gyi skyon gdags pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: are not speaking with the intention of understanding, but with the intention of finding fault.🔽The assembly in front of whom one would speak🔽are not suitable or appropriate,

original: gzu bo gang dag gi mdun du de smra bar bya ba'i tshogs de dag kyang rung ba ma yin zhing bya ba ma yin pa'am /🔽mngon bar zhen pa can dag go //
analyzed: gzu bo gang dag gi mdun du de smra bar bya ba'i tshogs de dag kyang rung ba ma yin zhing bya ba ma yin pa'am / mngon bar zhen pa can dag go //
translated: or they are attached.

original: smra bar bya ba thams cad kyang phal cher nyes pa drug dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: smra bar bya ba thams cad kyang phal cher nyes pa drug dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: All speech is mostly endowed with six faults:

original: 'di ltar smra bar byed pa na yang res 'ga' byung rgyal du phyogs ngan pa yang yongs su bzung nas mngon bar zhen pa dang / tshig dor dang ltag chod dang / chad pa'i gnas rnams la yang sbyor ba dang / tshig mjug tu phyin phyin du mi sdong par dus ma yin par smra bar rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar smra bar byed pa na yang res 'ga' byung rgyal du phyogs ngan pa yang yongs su bzung nas mngon bar zhen pa dang / tshig dor dang ltag chod dang / chad pa'i gnas rnams la yang sbyor ba dang / tshig mjug tu phyin phyin du mi sdong par dus ma yin par smra bar rtsom pa dang /
translated: When one speaks in this way, one sometimes speaks in a bad way, having taken up a bad position, and one is attached to one's own position; one uses words that are not appropriate, one uses words that are not to the point, one uses words that are not timely; one does not wait for the end of the other's speech in order to start speaking.

original: phyir rgol bas legs par smras kyang khyad du gsod de smod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas legs par smras kyang khyad du gsod de smod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One despises the other, even when he speaks well; this is the meaning of the expression one speaks badly.

original: tshig brlang po yang smra ba ste /
analyzed: tshig brlang po yang smra ba ste /
translated: One uses harsh words.

original: des phyir rgol ba la sogs pa'i sems 'khrugs par byed pa dang bdag kyang de dag la sems 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'di drug dang ldan pa @115b yin no //
analyzed: des phyir rgol ba la sogs pa'i sems 'khrugs par byed pa dang bdag kyang de dag la sems 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'di drug dang ldan pa @115b yin no //
translated: One disturbs the thought of the other, and one disturbs one's own thought.

original: nye bar zhi ba ni smra ba dkon no //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba ni smra ba dkon no //
translated: One who speaks little is peaceful.

original: nye bar ma zhi ba la ni gang gis gzhan dad pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i gnas dang ldan pa dang / rang gi sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba dang / rang gi sems bsrung ba gnyi ga dkon no //
analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba la ni gang gis gzhan dad pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i gnas dang ldan pa dang / rang gi sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba dang / rang gi sems bsrung ba gnyi ga dkon no //
translated: It is rare to find someone who is not agitated and who has the qualities of a liberated person, who can settle his own mind in concentration, and who can protect both his own mind and the minds of others.

original: smra ba phal cher ni ji ltar na bdag rgyal bar 'gyur zhing pha rol pham par 'gyur snyam pa'i sems de kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: smra ba phal cher ni ji ltar na bdag rgyal bar 'gyur zhing pha rol pham par 'gyur snyam pa'i sems de kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: For the most part, people speak with the thought, “How can I win and how can I make the other person lose?”

original: de yod na yongs su gdung pa'i sdug bsngal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na yongs su gdung pa'i sdug bsngal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is present, they are afflicted by the pain of anguish.

original: de yod na bde ba la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na bde ba la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is present, they do not rest in comfort.

original: de'i phyir rgyun mi chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun mi chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bar mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, they are unable to apply themselves constantly to spiritual practice.

original: de'i phyir khyad par thob par bya ba la ma thob pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par thob par bya ba la ma thob pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they fail to attain what they have not attained and they lose what they have attained.

original: pha dang ma ni bsad byas shing //
analyzed: pha dang ma ni bsad byas shing //
translated: “One should kill one’s father and mother🔽and also one’s wife and children.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni 'jig rten na gang shin tu kha na ma thob sdig tor rtsi ba da brjod pa'i yi ge rnams rnam par dag par yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni 'jig rten na gang shin tu kha na ma thob sdig tor rtsi ba da brjod pa'i yi ge rnams rnam par dag par yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: This verse is a transformation of the letters of the most censured of words into a pure form.

original: 'jig rten na shin tu kha na ma tho bar grags pa ni skye bo bla ma bsad pa dang / skye bo chen po bsad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na shin tu kha na ma tho bar grags pa ni skye bo bla ma bsad pa dang / skye bo chen po bsad pa'o //
translated: In the world, the most censured of actions is the killing of a superior being and the killing of a great person.

original: skye bo bla ma de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: skye bo bla ma de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: A superior being is of two kinds:

original: so sor nges pa dang / 'jig rten dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa dang / 'jig rten dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: one who is definite and one who is common to the world.

original: 'jig rten dang thun mong ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang thun mong ba la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One who is common to the world is also of two kinds:

original: yongs su skyong bar byed pa dang / sbyin gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su skyong bar byed pa dang / sbyin gnas so //
translated: one who is a protector and one who is a recipient of gifts.

original: de la so sor nges pa'i skye bo bla ma ni pha dang ma'o //
analyzed: de la so sor nges pa'i skye bo bla ma ni pha dang ma'o //
translated: One who is definite is one’s mother and father.

original: skyong bar byed pa ni rgyal po'o //
analyzed: skyong bar byed pa ni rgyal po'o //
translated: One who is a protector is the king.

original: sbyin gnas ni bram ze gtsang sbra can rnams te /
analyzed: sbyin gnas ni bram ze gtsang sbra can rnams te /
translated: One who is a recipient of gifts is a pure brahmin,

original: de dag ni shin tu dag par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu dag par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is well known to be pure.

original: de dag thams cad bsad na ni skye bo bla ma bsad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsad na ni skye bo bla ma bsad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one kills all of them, one is said to kill one's father.

original: skye bo chen po bsad pa ni yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo chen po bsad pa ni yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One kills a great person when one destroys a country with its king.

original: 'khor ni ba lang dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / ma he la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni ba lang dang / rta dang / rnga mo dang / ma he la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The country is the cattle, horses, camels, buffaloes, etc.

original: ji ltar yi ge 'di dag dag par yongs su bsgyur zhen /
analyzed: ji ltar yi ge 'di dag dag par yongs su bsgyur zhen /
translated: How are these words mother, etc. to be transformed into pure words?

original: ma la sogs pa bsad pa'i tshig ni sred pa la sogs pa spong bar yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa bsad pa'i tshig ni sred pa la sogs pa spong bar yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The words mother, etc. are transformed into the abandonment of craving, etc., because of the abandonment of craving, etc.

original: go rims bzhin du sred pa dang / las kyi sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis dang / skye mched drug spyod yul @116a * //🔽dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽ma la sogs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sred pa dang / las kyi sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis dang / skye mched drug spyod yul @116a * // dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas / ma la sogs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: In order, craving, craving for action, consciousness with grasping, the two views, and the six sense spheres with their objects are called mother, etc.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The six sense spheres with their objects are called mother, etc., because they are like a mother, etc.

original: de la sred pa ni mngon par grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la sred pa ni mngon par grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Craving is the cause of manifest existence.

original: las kyi srid pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: las kyi srid pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The existence of karma is the cause of birth.

original: de ni bsgom pa'i bag chags skyed pa'i tshul gyis pha lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i bag chags skyed pa'i tshul gyis pha lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be regarded as like a father, in the sense that it generates the latent tendencies of meditation.

original: rgyu 'di gnyis las ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'di gnyis las ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From these two causes, consciousness arises together with the appropriating aggregates.

original: de de ltar byung na thar pa 'dod du zin kyang mchog tu dag par yid ches par byed pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis thar pa thob pa la gegs byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar byung na thar pa 'dod du zin kyang mchog tu dag par yid ches par byed pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis thar pa thob pa la gegs byed do //
translated: When it arises in this way, even if one desires liberation, the two graspings, which are the supreme convictions about purity and excellence, obstruct the attainment of liberation.

original: 'di gnyis gtsang sbra can dang 'dra ba ni 'di lta bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis gtsang sbra can dang 'dra ba ni 'di lta bur rig par bya ste /
translated: These two should be understood as like the two purities,

original: 'di ltar mchog dang 'dag par mngon bar zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mchog dang 'dag par mngon bar zhen pa'o //
translated: because they are the convictions about purity and excellence.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i gnas dang dmigs pa'i dngos pos skye mched drug spyod yul dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i gnas dang dmigs pa'i dngos pos skye mched drug spyod yul dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The six sense spheres, together with their objects, should be understood as the basis and the objects of that consciousness.

original: yid mi ches dang byas mi gzo //
analyzed: yid mi ches dang byas mi gzo //
translated: Lack of faith and ingratitude,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni /
translated: This verse

original: don ngan pa brjod pa'i yi ge rnams mchog gi don du yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: don ngan pa brjod pa'i yi ge rnams mchog gi don du yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The letters which express evil meanings are transformed into the highest meaning.

original: 'jig rten na ngan pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ngan pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of evil in the world:

original: yid kyi las ngan pa dang / lus kyi las ngan pa dang / ngag gi las ngan pa dang / longs spyod ngan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las ngan pa dang / lus kyi las ngan pa dang / ngag gi las ngan pa dang / longs spyod ngan pa'o //
translated: evil of mind, evil of body, evil of speech, and evil of enjoyment.

original: yid kyi las ngan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yid kyi las ngan pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Evil of mind is twofold:

original: dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mi mthun pas yid mi ches pa ste //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mi mthun pas yid mi ches pa ste //
translated: not believing in the practice of virtue, and not believing in the practice of what is contrary to virtue.🔽Not believing in the practice of virtue is not applying oneself to generosity, etc.

original: 'jig rten pa rol la sogs pa la yid mi ches pas /🔽sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //🔽mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mthun pas byas pa mi gzo ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rol la sogs pa la yid mi ches pas / sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro // mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mthun pas byas pa mi gzo ba ste /
translated: because one does not believe in the world, in play, etc.🔽Not believing in the practice of what is contrary to virtue is not applying oneself to evil conduct, such as killing one's mother, etc.

original: sngon phan btags pa la mi lta bar ma gsod pa la sogs pas nyes par spyod pa la yang mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon phan btags pa la mi lta bar ma gsod pa la sogs pas nyes par spyod pa la yang mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not take into account what was done for oneself in the past.

original: lus kyi las ngan pa ni khyim 'bigs pa'i rkun po ste /
analyzed: lus kyi las ngan pa ni khyim 'bigs pa'i rkun po ste /
translated: Evil of body is a thief who breaks into houses,

original: 'tsho ba shin tu smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba shin tu smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one's livelihood is very much despised.

original: ngag gi las ngan pa ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa lhur len pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi las ngan pa ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa lhur len pa ste /
translated: Evil speech is the habit of lying, etc.

original: de lta bu dang ldan pa ni tshogs pa la sogs pa'i nang du 'jug tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //🔽longs spyod ngan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu dang ldan pa ni tshogs pa la sogs pa'i nang du 'jug tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro // longs spyod ngan pa ni /
translated: One who possesses such speech is not fit to enter an assembly, etc.

original: khyi dang / bya rog dang / yi nga gas la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyi dang / bya rog dang / yi nga gas la sogs pa ste /
translated: Evil enjoyments are the enjoyments of dogs, crows, pigs, etc.

original: skyugs pa za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyugs pa za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they eat vomit.

original: ji ltar yi ge 'di dag mchog gi don du yongs su bsgyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yi ge 'di dag mchog gi don du yongs su bsgyur zhe na /
translated: How are these letters transformed into the supreme meaning?

original: yid mi ches pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni dgra bcom par yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi ches pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni dgra bcom par yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “unbelieved,” etc., are transformed into “Arhat.”

original: de la yid mi ches pa ni rnam par grol ba'i @116b ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pas rang gi yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yid mi ches pa ni rnam par grol ba'i @116b ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pas rang gi yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, “unbelieved” is the one who has the vision of the knowledge of liberation, because he believes in himself.

original: byas pa mi gzo ba ni 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo ba ni 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Ungrateful” is the one who knows the unconditioned, nirvana.

original: khyim 'bigs par byed pa ni yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim 'bigs par byed pa ni yang srid par nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a house-breaker because it eliminates the afflictions that are the cause for taking up a new existence.

original: go skabs bcom zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go skabs bcom zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is a destroyer of opportunity

original: phyi ma la 'gro pa thams cad du sdug bsngal mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la 'gro pa thams cad du sdug bsngal mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not bring about the manifestation of suffering in the future.

original: skyugs pa za ba ni mthong ba'i chos la yo byad kyi stobs kyis lus 'dzin kyang longs spyod dang srog la re ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyugs pa za ba ni mthong ba'i chos la yo byad kyi stobs kyis lus 'dzin kyang longs spyod dang srog la re ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a consumer of vomit because, even though it maintains the body by the power of material means in this life, it is not concerned with enjoyments or life.

original: snying po med la snying por shes /
analyzed: snying po med la snying por shes /
translated: It is a knowledge of the essence in the inessential

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di'i don snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: . The meaning of this verse should be explained as before.

original: 'di'i lus ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis byang chub chen po la reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lus ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la brten nas mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gnyis kyis byang chub chen po la reg pa'o //
translated: This body is the bodhisattva’s, which, based on the meditative concentration, touches great enlightenment through the two paths of insight and cultivation.

original: ser sna'i chos nyid 'phel bar byed pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems ser sna'i bag la nyal spangs pas de'i de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna'i chos nyid 'phel bar byed pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i sems ser sna'i bag la nyal spangs pas de'i de bzhin nyid gnas gyur pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality of stinginess is increased means that the reality of stinginess is increased by the transformation into the suchness of stinginess, due to the elimination of the latent tendency of stinginess in the mind along with its traces.

original: sbyin pas yongs su skyo ba ni yun ring por sbyin pa'i rgyu mchog tu bya dka' bas ngal bar bya ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pas yongs su skyo ba ni yun ring por sbyin pa'i rgyu mchog tu bya dka' bas ngal bar bya ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Discouragement with giving means that one has undertaken the difficult task of giving for a long time.

original: slong ba la tshig pa za ba ni rang gis len par 'dod pas slong ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slong ba la tshig pa za ba ni rang gis len par 'dod pas slong ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Anger towards beggars means that one is not in accord with beggars because one wishes to take for oneself.

original: res 'ga' ni ci yang sbyin par mi byed pa ni dngos po thams cad rtag tu sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni ci yang sbyin par mi byed pa ni dngos po thams cad rtag tu sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sometimes one does not give anything at all means that one always gives everything.

original: sbyin pa las ring du gyur pa ni nye ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa las ring du gyur pa ni nye ba la sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Far from giving means that one abandons giving to those nearby, etc.

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Possessing pure conduct means

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: possessing the supramundane path.

original: 'khrig pa las gzhan du 'khrig pas nges par 'byung ba mi 'tshol ba ni de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes nas spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrig pa las gzhan du 'khrig pas nges par 'byung ba mi 'tshol ba ni de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes nas spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not seek liberation from sexuality other than through sexuality, because he has completely understood that reality just as it is and has abandoned it.

original: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: Here, complete understanding of reality just as it is

original: de'i de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as the realization of its suchness.

original: 'khrig pa spong ba la g-yeng ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa spong ba'i thabs la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrig pa spong ba la g-yeng ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa spong ba'i thabs la rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not distracted from abandoning sexuality, because he is intent on the means of abandoning sexual misconduct.

original: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags skyes pa dang du len pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags skyes pa dang du len pa ni /
translated: He accepts the arising of the passion of sexuality,

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags nang du skyes pa phyi rol du spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags nang du skyes pa phyi rol du spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he abandons the passion for sense objects that has arisen externally.🔽He is not afraid of the Dharma that is the antidote to sexuality, because he strives by means of the Dharma that is the antidote to liberate all beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of meditation, because he is intent on the bliss of meditation in order to develop beings.

original: 'khrig pa'i gnyen po'i chos kyis skrag pa ni de'i gnyen po'i chos kyis sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i @117a * //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i gnyen po'i chos kyis skrag pa ni de'i gnyen po'i chos kyis sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i @117a * //
translated: He is not attached to the bliss of liberation, because he is intent on the bliss of liberation in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the absence of conceptualization, because he is intent on the bliss of the absence of conceptualization in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the formless states, because he is intent on the bliss of the formless states in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the concentrations, because he is intent on the bliss of the concentrations in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the absorptions, because he is intent on the bliss of the absorptions in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the liberations, because he is intent on the bliss of the liberations in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the stages, because he is intent on the bliss of the stages in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the perfections, because he is intent on the bliss of the perfections in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the applications of mindfulness, because he is intent on the bliss of the applications of mindfulness in order to develop beings.

original: don du rtsol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du rtsol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not attached to the bliss of the correct exertions, because he is intent on the bliss of the correct exertions in order to develop beings.🔽He is not attached to the bliss of the supports for miraculous abilities, because he is intent on the bliss of the supports for miraculous abilities in order to develop beings.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par gnyis kyis gnyis sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par gnyis kyis gnyis sbyor ba ni /
translated: He is not attached to the bliss of the faculties, because he is intent on the bliss of the faculties

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ba gnyis kyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ba gnyis kyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis la snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: One enters into the mundane and supramundane meditative concentrations through the two, i.e., calm abiding and insight, and through the two, i.e., afflicted and purified meditative development.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis kyis 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bye brag gis bden pa bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don du 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gnyis la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis kyis 'bras bu dang rgyu'i bye brag gis bden pa bzhi'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i don du 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gnyis la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One enters into the mundane and supramundane paths through the two, i.e., the truth of the path and the truth of cessation, which are distinguished as results and causes, through the two, i.e., afflicted and purified meditative development.

original: bstan bcos 'di ci'i phyir chos mngon par kun las btus pa zhes bya bar ming btags she na /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ci'i phyir chos mngon par kun las btus pa zhes bya bar ming btags she na /
translated: Why is this treatise called the Compendium of Higher Knowledge?

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis rtogs nas bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis rtogs nas bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a compendium of the higher knowledge through the method of definition.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs shing khong du chud nas mdor bsdus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs shing khong du chud nas mdor bsdus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattvas, having realized and penetrated thatness, are said to be a compendium.

original: kun las btus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i mdo rnams las te /
analyzed: kun las btus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i mdo rnams las te /
translated: Because it is a compendium of all, i.e., of the sutras of the higher knowledge.

original: bsam pa'i gnas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam pa'i gnas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because all the bases of thought are included.

original: yang dag par mtho ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i thabs kyis sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du thob par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par mtho ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i thabs kyis sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar du thob par byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because it is the basis of correct elevation, up to the attainment of Buddhahood by means of unerring methods.

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa'i bshad pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of Abhidharma🔽is completed.

original: slob dpon chen po rgyal ba'i sras kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon chen po rgyal ba'i sras kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The great master Jinaputra composed it.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o//
translated: The Indian abbot Jinamitra and the translator-editor Yeshé Dé translated and edited it.
